i understand what you mean it hurts when i spend multiple all nighters to then see my game get taken down by a roblox bot or get destroyed into the void by the algorithm but i would like to stress that not all studios are like this there are good developers on the platform that bring interesting and unique things to roblox it is a shame that there are some bad apples that give the platform a bad rep that plus the limits of the roblox engine its self and the fact that roblox gives us pretty crappy exchange rates which can be the reason roblox games have so many microtransactions though i don't defend these actions and defiantly am against pay win best way to find good roblox games for you and your child is to avoid the front page games they are often the more clickily microtransaction games of the platform instead i'd recommend searching online for some roblox games that fit you and your childs favoured genre there are a lot of youtube videos on good roblox games i'm not big developer or anything but i thought that might be a little bit more helpful anyway hope this helps

please stop with the assumptions i read your edit up in the post not the comments and you're immediately branding anyone who goes against your opinion a roblox shill or a year old kid that really doesn't encourage thoughtful discussion and kind of shows me that there's no point trying to talk to you as you're opinion's already been made i'm not sure if you know this but roblox does not make the games all of roblox's content is completely player made well with the exception of some events and tutorial games heck the whole point of roblox originally was kids making games and playing other kid's games what does this mean any multiplayer game has the danger of adults and susceptible children meeting it's not a new thing usually the multiplayer game has safeguards such as safe chat child friendly mode or whatever but in the end it's ultimately up to you to teach your kid how to behave safely and responsibly online the game can only do so much it's almost the same in roblox's case these are multiplayer interactions between players to players people playing other player's games not player to company you see that's the huge difference they can't be held accountable in the same ways i hope you understand that i'm putting emphasis on you and your son for a reason not because i only read a few sentences of your comments the solution is with you guys not the other way around look i understand that these practices are quite shitty but there's a real difference between actual scams and these scams i've seen games get taken down for real scams for instance you buy a gamepass that promises a sword but all you get is a crappy t shirt that's a real bonifide scam meanwhile with your case you're getting what you pay for sure the game could only last one more day after you buy a gamepass and now you feel cheated but the gamepass never promised how long the game would last did it scummy but legal these practices are not criminal despite how close they may seem taking action against things like these leave a huge precedent and could be damaging for all of roblox let's talk about the targeting aspect and the kids being taken advantage of where does the solution lie that's right with you your son is choosing to play these games and therefore he must learn how to deal with the issues on this platform he is choosing to play these scammy games despite there being tons of other games out there issues that are out of his control like nudity swearing etc that is the type of stuff roblox is trying to prevent children should never ever be taken advantage of by adults i agree but its the goddamn internet it never ever will be safe like c'mon if your child can't handle roblox maybe it's not the company's fault it's not roblox's job on how to teach your kid st century skills they do what they can but when it comes to issues born out of free will what the hell are they supposed to do your kid wants to buy this stuff and if it's due to manipulation and targeting then you need to teach him how to defend to against this shit as long as free speech exists manipulation will too connecting your child to the internet comes with huge responsibilities you know that if you don't want to deal with this kind of stuff then of course you can withdraw your kids from playing roblox if you believe that's the safest choice for you and your kids then good for you you're making the choices here i've said my piece have a wonderful day

inadequate parental controls despite combing the internet there seems to be no mechanism by which you can either block those games which you feel are inappropriate for a child’s given age or if you go with the limited “curated content only” your child is prohibited from chatting with any friends in any game whatsoever this seems entirely unreasonable the over under setting does little to nothing the “allow only curated content” still shows all of the user generated content simply with an x over the play sign so the child can still see everything they can’t play gets frustrated about it as they seek curated content and can’t talk with friends the “all or nothing” approach to safety and security for children feels more like mere lip service to parents who are trying to monitor their children’s internet time a or year old wants to play roblox so they can chat with their friends prohibiting this defeats the purpose of the entire platform and really prohibits the child from effectively playing many of the games which require some level of communication furthermore displaying all that the child is not allowed to play merely insights frustration as opposed to many other internet mechanisms by which a parent can block an app a website or a game that is inappropriate after which it no longer shows up furthermore many of the games in the user generated content are age appropriate for younger kids and are the more popular games so the curated option includes removing the ability for a child to play games which are both popular and age appropriate ie islands at the same time roblox does nothing to monitor inappropriate games with xenophobic or sexual themes and deprives the parent of the ability to block these games from a child the entire parental safety mechanism is wholly inadequate every other type of platform allows for customization of age rated games customization of chat mechanisms and the ability of the parent to help their child play safely this includes the internet itself where websites can be blocked or allowed lastly the ability to monitor roblox chats only along with inability to monitor in game chats without the parent watching live the entire time is a serious failure of the platform this system sets parents up for failure and promotes frustration and resentment with the children roblox claims to be concerned about the safety and well being of their players yet they take no responsibility for monitoring user generated content provide no realistic mechanism which allows a parent to work with the child to determine what is appropriate which varies greatly even between ages and and places all responsibility of reporting inappropriate content or behavior on the users which for the record they do little or nothing about i have personally reported games which i have witnessed sexual content and the encouragement of inappropriate and sexual behavior i have provided screenshots as proof i have received nothing more than a canned response saying i should enable “curated content” only and refusing to address the inability to chat once this is implemented i have reported games which promote violence in conjunction with xenophobic themes i provided screenshots in support thereof again i received a canned response about parental controls never mind the fact that child can create a new account with nothing more than a name and a birthdate which does nothing to block content aside from a few ### in chats at what point does roblox take any responsibility for their content and or lack of useful safety settings which would at least allow a parent to have reasonable controls over what their child can play and do on the platform if a roblox is going to market to kids from years of age see their toys to young adults there needs to be more than the current useless black and white all or nothing parental controls the technology exists they simply refuse to implement it and or make it available i can only assume their “concern for the children”propaganda is nothing more than a public affairs cya as they hoist all of the responsibility of monitoring behavior and content of their platform onto their young players which maybe just maybe would fly if they ever actually did anything about it but their statements re their concern are disingenuous at best given the lack of response when said reports are actually made this is not unreasonable and this is not the ranting of a parent who doesn’t want to monitor their child’s activity these are the words of a concerned parent watching a company market to millions of young children who are desperate for socialization especially during a pandemic and making millions on them and their parents while depriving users and their parents of the most simplistic of tools needed to ensure the safety and well being of our kids and on a final note the recommendations by some that parents can just block the game as a whole or just set the all or nothing restrictions and get over it is not a response or solution it’s ignoring the problem and passing the buck

for parents who are struggling to keep their sanity and their kids busy for parents who are struggling to keep their sanity and their kids busy i'd recommend introducing them to roblox roblox is a video game that can be played on phones tablets or on the computer it is very kid friendly and oriented and has good parental controls and it helps with kids' creativity imagination social skills grammar spelling and more there are lots of worlds kids can explore there including going to a waterpark delivering pizza at a pizza place baking cookies even going to school enough to keep them busy and entertained for hours if you need the time both me and my wife work from home often and we don't have care right now because of the coronavirus and roblox has been a blessing keeping our kid busy when we need our time she started playing just before all the covid events happened and this really saved us she even started her own [youtube channel] which inspired other kids in her class to join and play the game and she can play with her classmates and have playdates on roblox instead of in the real life you can show those vids to your kids if you want them to see what roblox is like and how fun it can be also it's a game parents and kids can enjoy playing together sometimes too so anyway hopefully this helps parents in similar situation

we're having similar struggles we don't allow our ten year old son to play roblox or fortnite or have a smartphone or have tik tok but it's pretty much all over the place even for th graders my son doesn't have direct access to any of it but he's exposed all the time another issue we've noticed is that most kids don't want to play or be outside unless it's for sports practice we've had a lot of nice weather the past few weeks and all my son and his friends do is play inside they all go to one kid's house because they have a finished basement with every video game device and multiple ipads they at least have been into playing beyblades which is better than constant screens still though i'm disheartened that they never want to *move their bodies* we have a large backyard and an official soccer goal what group of kids wouldn't enjoy yards worth of flat greenspace with a soccer goal and our trampoline i hate becoming that aging curmudgeon of a parent but i don't think it's healthy the direction our society is heading in regards to constant screen time but i guess that's a different topic if i were you i would try to plan the hangouts more constructively but in our experience they'll just decide to go to someone else's house if they can't do what they want

keep in mind this is just my opinion experience and i don’t believe it is more valid than anyone else here i let my son play roblox most of the time i actually play with him i’ve set parental controls and chat filters which seem to work just fine key thing is i play with him so i actually know what he’s seeing the problem is more complex than just letting your kid play or not imo it’s about trust and communication your child is going to be exposed to all of these things you don’t allow tiktok fortnite roblox and everything else that you say no to and other kids get to do your kid could start to sneak things past you which violates trust or build resentment because it effects their social life look at it from the kids perspective you say “no because there are bad things on there” but how come every other kid gets to do this i say every other in reference to the play date last thing i will add is prep our job as parents is to prep our children socially morally etc for the real world your kid is going to be exposed to things you don’t agree with at some point and simply dismissing that fact isn’t going to prepare them for what to do in those situation that’s why i personally allow my son to play these games but i also participate as well we can bond and discuss these sort of things together i don’t agree with a one size fits all for child content some kids can handle five nights at freddy’s for example others can’t and shouldn’t play it it’s all about how well you know communicate and trust your child

this is a hard balance to find on one hand the average kid has way too much internet access these days but on the other restricting them from sharing the same experiences as their peers can have long lasting effects socially there's not really a right or wrong answer personally i let mine have it but it's all monitored voice chat is turned off and she's only allowed to friend people she knows in real life not saying that's the correct choice it's just what we've gone with for the time being as for the inappropriate stuff remember that it's mostly user created content roblox is almost like a more restricted version of secondlife if you remember that the game creation tool is designed for kids to use so seeing maps in the shape of genitalia or whatever is far more likely to be a year old who thinks it's funny than an adult doing so for less savory reasons doesn't change that there's genitals on the screen of course but it helps to understand the context and also not that this makes it okay but at + it's not like they aren't seeing that stuff at school anyway pre teens have been drawing dicks on stuff since the dawn of time last time i was on my kids' playground a k school i counted of them drawn in chalk

i also don’t let my kids play roblox or youtube kids minecraft is a far better alternative collaborative art projects also work well with this age group but require a lot of planning it’s one of the reason minecraft is so popular you can build together

i might get shit for this but i let my kids play kid games some of them are trivia some of them are world building some of them are obstacle courses some of them where you collect and raise pets in game purchases suck but that's the way of games these days thankfully my kids don't blow their money on junk food candy so i'm fine with a few bucks here and there on their entertainment much cheaper than a day at dave and busters and the like roblox is kind of a digital arcade there are all sorts of games in there and you just have to be observant of what your kids play mine play next to us most of the time so we see what they like and are into we often help out with their game and give feedback just like a real arcade some games are just not great for kids of certain age groups anyone suggesting letting your kid play roblox on the days their friends visit doesn't realize that your child will be far far behind in skill ability compared to their peers that won't be fun for them either fwiw my kids are and they play various mario overcooked dance games on the switch and minecraft and roblox on the ipad and i see no issue with these games with how they've been enjoying them i have voice chat off and they're told to only talk to people they know in real life any friend requests online are denied my oldest did get a request to trade one of her pets and got scammed out of giving away her pet for nothing after that she learned to listen to us on being careful of trusting people outside her real life group of friends and how to approach unknown places for that my kids stick to places they know and they ask us about new worlds within roblox before playing they also report to us if there's something they learn isn't appropriate for now they're allowed to keep playing suffice to say learning real world lessons in a virtual arena has its benefits

personally i just rememeber how i was at that age my parents didn't get youtube as it was just starting when i was a preteen anime certain games like final fantasy x that had some suggestive scenes etc and i just ended up sneaking it so they had absolutely no control over when i was consuming or going over to friends who were allowed it all the way back to when i was little and wasn't allowed to watch power rangers for the violence so i sneakily watched it instead porn blocks and strictly nothing with any suggestive scenes just meant that my friends and i ended up huddled around a library copy of clan of the cave bear a great book but having a brutal rape scene being our first depiction of sex written or visual at wasn't great basically kids will always find a way trying to dam the river often ends up in the dam breaking better to just try and channel the flow for example i asked my parents to let me get a tattoo at and they could have a say on it my mom was open to it as she knew i'd otherwise do it without their input on size placement image my dad just said no and that there was no way i'd be able to i had a palm sized tattoo on my ribs by the end of the weekend overall i think being very strict just breeds habits of lies and sneaky behavior anecdotally the kids i saw with super strict parents like mine acted out more once we could and just ended up lying more and having a worse relationship with parents as teens+new adults there was definitely a happy medium with some boundaries and rules but not always being on the stricter end of every situation too few boundaries also had issues in today's world kids are being brought into a different society than we were technology and screens are going to be a big part of that no screens at all during the week that's strict by anyone's standards an argument could be made that it could stunt their proficiency and intuitiveness with certain tech later on as is being proven by toddlers using tablets having earlier fine motor control and pattern recognition bbc documentary there are a bunch of studies and articles touting the positives of screens in moderation as tools for example my almost yo has coding apps for kids that he's allowed to play outside normal screen time vilifying screens and the virtual world is frankly reductionist; it's far more grey and nuanced than your comments portray now for roblox itself you call it stupid and that you admittedly don't get it that is you putting your judgement of its value over your child's its sheer popularity shows its entertainment value i don't get why my son likes some of the games he does but heck that's his free time and his choice to spend it how he likes we bond over watching him play together and keep an open line of communication skills beyond the jump scare games touch wood and even the jump scare doors game we just play together and he watches me play and helps so we're laughing and joking as we play i love horror movies always have so i get his draw to the adrenaline of jump scares we just have open dialogues about what's appropriate same as watching harry potter and he knows there are more but we're waiting to watch them i've said is largely opinion based so maybe widen your point of view from stating opinions as facts and judging from there

hi there definitely agree with your post and it has merit my son has classmates friends of his that pretend play they are characters from roblox they will not let him play because he does not play roblox it is so sad to me that they won't let him play or rather that they care so much more about roblox than they do about anything else but i tell my son that he doesn't need roblox to have real friends and besides he knows he is getting a guitar for christmas he can't learn to play like u or aerosmith if he spends all his time playing roblox i also gave him a lesson about peer pressure and putting too much stock in what others think is cool i would have gone with your gut the first time

that’s why steve jobs didn’t allow his kids to use ipad his gens spent time hacking computers in their free time and he knew he had built the most addictive tech for kids ever my daughters peers yr old are glued to the screen even before they can feel bored i had to be the one to see her being left out just because i she couldn’t hang out with her friends without staring at their screen i’m teaching her self control but sometime it’s hard when the whole room you are the only one who’s not a zombie and i totally blame the parents for taking the easy way out for their own sanity even when it’s unnecessary screens are so naturally addictive to kids my m old baby is already reaching for the phone what amaze me is adults with no self control who are offering their kids screen every chance they get instead of doing actual parenting

roblox is trash in quite a number of ways i'm very pro gaming but roblox is not allowed in this house i'm considering actually setting up a little gaming centre for the kids to play other games like minecraft etc on way more constructive and endless mods for different game types out there i have most of the hardware capability but need to work out how i'm going to get multiple game copies sometimes they'll be able to use their own accounts for games like minecraft but i'll need multiples for other games last train out of wormtown has become a huge hit with my kids and you only need one licence per gamers

my kids play roblox but it’s not something they’d obsess over so i understand kids have different personalities and they get stuck on different things i’ve noticed that it’s something they also do together with their friends sometimes playing roblox so it’s not always a matter “if they play roblox they don’t do stuff together” they do it’s super social just like a board game can be doing joint projects in the game and designing their houses or something also gotta say the older they get the more they do other stuff with their friends out of the house as well my kids are and and they go do stuff with their friends without my involvement or the other’s parents they’ll ask can we go to the trampoline park and they’ll go there by themselves by bus if no parent is driving them they go to the stable with their friends just to hang out cause they both love horses and they know how to get there roblox comes and goes but at this age it’s not the main thing in life for sure but said all that your house your rule so if you say no roblox no ipads then that’s the way sometimes boredom does make the best inventions

i’m fine with my kiddo playing roblox with his friends they usually facetime in groups and play nearly every day together on weekdays after homework is done which to me is great socialization but we also take him out a lot to outdoor activities playdates at his friends’ homes festivals restaurants parties sports etc… where very little zero screen time is involved and lots of movies at the movie theaters 🍿 we love going out basically screens and roblox aren’t evil everything in moderation… and when you feel it’s right and appropriate is key

i let my kids play a lot of games halo to diablo but all the stuff i let them play is locked down socially and i know what they are getting i have seen the strange stuff in roblox and to be honest it had the yahoo chat rooms vibe to me the amount of people spamming vague kink messages was disturbing there are a million games out there roblox will noy be one they are allowed to play minecraft is always welcome in our house they have a realm to play on some people want to play roblox but i tell them it's not allowed in our house i also make them get permission from their parents before we play any games that are t or m diablo is a giant cartoon but some parents do not want their preteens playing it and i get it it's about respect

roblox’s most popular maps tend to be skinner boxes that constantly tempt you to spend some cash to be a little bit stronger to get over this little hurdle etc lots of parents give their kids roblox gift cards too which goes towards this number inflation the whole thing is incredibly addictive for kids and teaches bad lessons i applaud you for sticking to your guns here we’ve also banned it at home for similar reasons

i don't allow roblox for my year old i'm years old and have grown up with unmoderated tech access i've seen what is on the internet and in online gaming and i don't want that for my son i let him play minecraft switch and pbs kids or some installed 'vintage' computer games like nancy drew and ispy ones i grew up with i also give him mostly no screen time i tried using parental controls on youtube kids but there's variations for the same channels you block there's weird sterioded dopamine smashing content worse than what i grew up with annoying orange fred cow and chicken college humor charlie the unicorn vine etc so i banned that when he was i kind of wish basic kids phones like the firefly phone i had at and still existed had buttons for parents pre saved numbers and an emergency button i let my son pick whatever movies and shows from disney plus or pbs kids only i do academic enrichment stuff one on one together all in all to say that i understand also specifically because i am a young dad and know how bad tech can be to kids because it was bad for me growing up on the internet our kids need parents to step in i would make sure going forward to tell your kids friends and their parents no devices when they come over again but to bring art supplies or movie ideas outdoor play equipment etc also you can tell your kiddo that while it may suck right now they will have a healthier brain in the long run

maybe try to irganize outdoor playdates go somewhere with the group of kids i have a yo and the vision of him meeting with his friends to play with tablets is really depressing hell no boardgames or playing together on the splitscreen otherwise no playdate at all you are doing great

this is not a new problem even though the internet is definitely scary as parents anecdotally i was in the early the nineties and my parents were adamant about no tvs and by default no video games during my whole childhood because they had a zero tv screen rule at home i became obsessed with tv haha i would do anything to secretly watch tv at my friends house and i would watch the worst shows now as an adult i still have terrible taste in tv whereas most of my friends who were allowed tv as kids barely watch it as adults this experience taught be a lot about parenting being too restrictive can have the opposite desired effect like others are saying i think it’s good to have good communication with your child about safety and supervision over restriction in the real world there are screens and they will ultimately be exposed so it’s important to teach healthy balance

i chose the lesser evil we have video game consoles a hand me down x box and a nintendo wii with games i bought used online my child is only allowed to play it with other people so he and his friends play that instead of roblox i am going to get him the play station for christmas so he has something “cool” enough that his friends won’t complain about not being allowed to do roblox i don’t allow playing online with anyone else he doesn’t know i think roblox is a cesspool and i hate that i can’t monitor also frankly the games are user created garbage video games generally actually have some decent benefits based on research team play hand eye coordination but i only let my child use it on playdates because they can be a timesuck and i also want him to read more also when my son goes to other kids’ houses i don’t have restrictions and just accept that he might be exposed to stuff but hopefullly it is not a lot

my girls have a private server for only them and any friends they invite with that said it's your choice don't listen to the idiots who want to judge you as a parent based on one rule you keep it's not easy to plan these things most friends of my year old also prefer being on their phones watching youtube shorts or playing roblox i don't manage what their friends do but my littles know they cannot play on an open server and i have explained why

my kids play roblox and other video games when we are just at home hanging out we do not allow online games when friends are over though they have to think of non video game activities to do or they can all play switch games with everyone in the living room it has to be inclusive though so if a sibling wants to join they can and everyone gets to choose the game together sometimes even that is enough of a deterrent to get them to do something else
roblox is boring anyway they just walk around encourage actual games

it can be tough when you're trying to encourage a variety of activities during a playdate but the allure of a game like roblox is strong especially for tweens here's an idea for next time

column1: you could have a chat with your tween beforehand and explain the plan for the day let her know that while roblox isn't an option you're open to suggestions for other activities that she and her friends might enjoy this way she's part of the decision making process

you can also provide alternatives like arts and crafts outdoor games or a movie night sometimes offering a bit of structure can help ensure that there's a balance between screen time and more interactive activities
ultimately it's about finding a middle ground where everyone has fun and your tween still gets to hang out with her friends without feeling left out

i'm sorry that some people are so cruel i personally agree with this philosophy for a few reasons but honestly the main reason to me is that it's just a time suck a time suck and a money suck there is literally no point to the game other than leveling up and spending real life money on in game currency for whatever little things on the in game economy my kids are and months and i already have a game app ban list and anyone saying that this will destroy kids' social lives is ridiculous enriching social interaction cannot happen with everyone's faces in their own screens all the time same games or not i think the best solution to the issue of all the kids showing up with their own devices is to either talk to the other parents beforehand and come to an agreement amongst the adults about a mutually enforced screentime limit or plan or put a device bin near the door for all non essential devices to be deposited until it's time for screen time

honestly we spend a lot of money on nerf darts because it causes the kids to want to run and play but when my husband got mad at our kids for not wanting to play outside i asked him when was the last time he and i played outside kids emulate what they see a lot of adults are too tired to do much stuff outside after everything and we don't do the stay out til the streetlights come on at least in my area

i hated the outdoors as a child because i was asthmatic and allergic to everything and constantly getting bitten by bugs and didn't like getting dirty anxiety thing but i loved creative pretend play and the best playdates usually involved some sort of small plastic being barbie bratz polly pocket hot wheels littlest pet shop dudes lego or perhaps a combination thereof polly and spider man often dated because there was a vaguely polly sized spider man action figure in the mix and some good ol' open world storytelling as we got older we'd have bake dates to make cupcakes or cookies or banana bread and then go upstairs and experiment with makeup while we ate and gossiped that's the kind of relationship i'm trying to build with my little niblings too one based on the idea that being indoorsy doesn't have to be synonymous with screens of the time

i see this mentality from loads of parents then i see them fkin glued to their phones to their social media all the time we often forget our kids are little monkeys who will mirror us just check how much your screen was on today i just checked i had a busy day and still managed to read reddit for hours and it didn’t feel that much for sure our generation are the pioneers of smart tech our children are born with a smartphone in their hand basically we have a y old daughter trying to only use screens to facetime with grandparents or to listen to music on spotify and yet she is already showing great skills in using the phone which we find shocking hard question that’s for sure but not surprising what we are seeing today

i feel like the s were the perfect time to be a kid sure we had lots of amazing video games and technologies coming out at the time but we also tended to want to have some time away from that from time to time i remember being a kid and loving to jump on my trampoline and carve sticks and look for bugs but i also loved to play mario inside sometimes but not all the time it was just the time

this is a really insightful response and something i also strive to do as a father to my kids my daughter plays roblox with heavy parental controls and i sometimes jump in and play with her it’s a fun bonding experience to dive into her world and see things as she does when i jumped in with her we played virtual “house” and we just made dinner had a dance party decorated the house and drove around town other times i’ve seen her play trivia games or play through some obstacle courses i’m a gamer myself so maybe that’s why i encourage stuff like this over just consuming a tv show for an hour i agree that roblox can definitely hit a little differently than other games like mario kart in that it can be super addicting and there really aren’t forced breaks built into the game we have had to make very strict rules about doing roblox only on weekends and not before bed

a few of my concerns about roblox are i really don’t like the way kids become when they play roblox specifically a total zombie i find all the endless games difficult to control it’s impossible to “vet” them all roblox seems to be made to be as addictive as possible betweeen robux and the structure of the game it’s hitting kids in the right spot i’m okay with my kids being a bit different to stay healthy i think and research supports that a lot of kids have too much screen time i don’t want to introduce something addictive mario party feels more fun light and collaborative

i’m with you op i limit screens as much as possible i have a year old boy he hates me sometimes because i limit his screen time and i only let him play minecraft and a few other computer games like sasquatch he does not have his own device and he does not have a switch i know people say to teach kids to be responsible with the internet instead of blocking stuff but really at they aren’t developmentally mature enough to limit their own content or not interact with weirdos or limit their time or know what is inappropriate i have to do that for them because that’s literally my job as a parent i’ve had a kid come over for a playdate and being their switch i don’t get it i thought playdates were so they could socialize without screens screen time is for when i need a break and the kids are home i’m going to continue to be a stick in the mud with this as long as i can i don’t care if my kid is the only one who doesn’t have access to tiktok etc i’m scared about what this access to the internet will do to our kids and i wish more parents would be vocal about getting parental controls set up i myself feel slightly inept at how to keep up with this as an elder millennial but i do try the other night i was shocked to hear that their kids have no internet controls on their devices like hello ’ do you want your year old to be encountering hard core porn wtf is wrong with people agh sorry for the rant

i want to reiterate that all of this is just my opinion there’s no perfect way to parent and i could be totally wrong also every kid is different and the way to parent them is usually just as complex your feelings are totally valid it’s a tough and really scary world out there i was given unrestricted access to the internet at a very young age and while i’m a decently normal individual there were definitely things i shouldn’t have seen i don’t think you’re wrong i would just hate to see a negative relationship form out of you trying your best to be a good parent we had two boys when i was in school who weren’t allowed to watch most things that were popular at the time most kids thought they were weird and completely alienated them over it it had a negative impact on one of them also in your defense think of this as a way to bond with your child even if you still say no you can talk to your child about why hear her thoughts on the matter as well maybe she only wants to play because of peers maybe she just wants a further explanation maybe it’s none of the above but communication is key this is an age kids really become independent and won’t just accept a “because i said so” as easily as talking it out whatever you decide to do just step into it with the want to understand so you can be a better more informed parent for your child’s needs

is be interested to hear your thoughts on roblox i'm super happy that that game missed our house i'm very uncomfortable about the creepy ness potential of roblox we are big in to fortnite minecraft and sorry games here it's not a screwball time issue as much as a i don't trust roblox

by roblox is done with for most kids my year old started playing roblox and minecraft in first grade heavily supervised there’s a lot of great and imaginative things to do and build there i’m amazed by what he’s able to construct and the story boarding around the creations i think you should take a closer look and see how you can allow this while setting limits and starting conversations around the limits my kids know not to ask for robux unless it’s for a bday or xmas present it was a good entry point into how these companies make their money and why some things are “free” and others aren’t we delved into hidden costs and how when a product is free you are usually the actual product we also discussed the addictive nature of some aspects of gaming and how pricing structures work they also know why their chat is largely disabled and who they can friend and who they can’t and why it takes some follow up conversations and questions but i rather my kids understand how life works while i can guide them let them experiment in safety with training wheels on check in often and take it away if rules aren’t followed

its not that there aren’t good games or wholesome fun to be had on roblox it’s that the platform itself is a bit of a wilderness where kids can just wander into games “experiences” that are based on a scary or inappropriate concept there are many *games* within roblox that are fun and conceptually “safe” — a cute one where you run around collecting cats or a funny one where you are a cat and you run around knocking things down or an elaborate fairy princess world where you can fly and have your own apartment but then your kid can exit that game and walk right into one where you’re being stalked by screaming jump scares or viewing totally age inappropriate memes or images popping up there’s also in game chat with other players the chat filters can be gotten around with creative spelling so kids can still be exposed to concepts or words they shouldn’t be learning about reading yet and clearly people can be on there targeting kids or attempting to groom them not good stuff — a parent who admittedly plays roblox with their slightly older kids

i don’t disagree microtransactions are a big problem in all of gaming right now especially the games that are geared towards kids i personally don’t like roblox and luckily my child is more into mario but if the day comes where he does get into roblox or another game with heavy emphasis on microtransactions i’m going to sit him down and teach him about them as best as i can as for the predatory behavior from adults thats a hard one as a young gamer i’ve had my own experiences with it it unfortunately is a danger in many corners online i think the best way to mediate it is to engage with your child on whatever game he is interested in that way you can observe and teach them what to stay away from i can see why roblox would be a concern in that area

that’s fair roblox does seem more problematic in certain areas i find that introducing children to couch co op games are a great way to engage with them in video games without the problems of online exposure but i think you already mentioned mario party didn’t work so maybe you’ve already thought of that jacksbox party games are also a lot of fun also for the record i don’t think any kid should play mortal kombat letting me play that at such a young age was definitely a blunder on my parents part sure was fun though 😅 all in all it might not fix everything but i’ve seen first hand that parents engaging with kids in games they are worried about tends to help the kids learn the rights and wrongs of an online space safely i understand that might not be possible for every parent but it’s something to consider

thank you i did decide to create an account today and i’ve played on it a bit i didn’t love what i see some of the avatars for the games were even inappropriate sexy looking girls a lot of the games you just walk around i don’t really get it ill ask my child to show me i didn’t add this to my previous post my daughter had a roblox account and then i added parental controls later and she said it made her lame because she couldn’t play with her friends because they didn’t have these controls this is eventually what led us to banning it this was maybe years ago we do allow minecraft i love minecraft actually the only things we have banned are fnaf and roblox

a lot of the games are really dumb many of them are created by kids my one son’s friend has learned how to program because of roblox so it can be difficult finding some of the few good ones i literally only play roblox when my son wants me to and honestly miss the days when he liked minecraft lol i will say that even without the parent controls that chat is super censored to the point it’s frustrating because most names all numbers and of course profanity are all banned and come up as #### kids will try to get around it but roblox doesn’t mess around with banning them when they do that’s not to say they’re perfect… far from it and it’s normally just trying to say a swear word pushing boundaries as preteens tend to do if you can get past some of the skimpier avatars they actually typically disliked by the preteen boys and are called “softies” which apparently means “sweet” and “caring” man i’m getting old i would maybe have him check out some of the games i suggested it’s the role playing and the sims type games where you just walk around that i think are the ones where creeps show up here’s a small description on the games i suggested; **pet sim x** you get a starter pet and that pet mines coins for you so you can open eggs which contains new and more powerful pets this allows you to unlock more areas and therefore better pets they usually have events and such too but i think the game is dying **blade ball** you have to have good reflexes for this one you’re put in an arena and a ball is parried between all the players getting faster after each parry if you miss and it hits you you’re out of the round you can earn coins to open loot boxes for new sword skins and abilities **super bomb survival** one i actually enjoy you and your friends are put into an arena as bombs of all types drop from the sky and your goal is survive until the timer runs out again you earn coins and unlock abilities like a super speed or a temporary protective bubble each time you survive the levels get more intense **epic fidget hunt** you have to find all of the pop it fidgets in a level to progress to the next you always know what you still have to find so it’s not as frustrating you can even spawn them in and pop them or use them to help you find new ones some levels require decent critical thinking skills my son and always love when a new level comes out **find the pop tarts** similar to fidget hunt but much more involved as you have to complete tasks to get to new areas i really like the puzzle aspect of this one **pet story ** i don’t know a lot about this other than it’s a story based game it looked cute from what i can tell i just remembered a few others **islands** basically minecraft in roblox but done surprisingly well **dungeon quest** dungeon crawler game level up upgrade gear and take on harder dungeons **parkour run** run through a bunch of obstacles as quick as you can and try to finish first a little different than the other obby or time trial games and is pretty fun there’s also a few “simulator” games that aren’t bad like fishing simulator mining simulator and surprisingly even laundry simulator sorry for the data dump a lot of the content on roblox is crap but there are a few diamonds in the ruff aka tolerable enough for me if you have any questions or type of games your son is looking for or any you might be concerned about don’t hesitate to reach out

i have had the same issue as you and basically we have a rule that real money can’t be spent on in game transactions in this house roblox is also nearly banned here because of its addictive nature and the way there are low quality games in it that just involve tapping the screen repeatedly to get more coins or whatever — basically the same as a slot machine i’ve put a half hour a day time limit on the ipad for roblox so it’s not banned outright but very limited — a harm minimisation move basically this strategy has worked well for us of course there’s pushback at first arguing and tantrums but once the kids got off the crack feed of roblox they’ve kind of forgotten about it might be a bit harder with your kid and her youtube channel about it unfortunately we also have a rule that the kids aren’t allowed to watch game streaming youtubers because of the addictive nature of them too and how it makes the kids want to emulate them which in my view is not a valuable and positive contribution to society compared to other things they could be doing… just my view though

i have a seven year old with adhd and autisim and let me tell you no i don't think roblox is appropriate there are many games some are very innocent and ona tablet where they can't talk to anyone okay but you have to know which games are okay and know that a lot of adults play on those games and to me it's creepy i don't let my son play them anymore and won't again because some of the stuff on there is not okay honestly i barely let my kids ply minecraft and usually with me my yr old gets to play without me right there but for a seven year old just know they are going to be exposed to a lot of language and want to buy a ton of stuff i personally think they are awful for small kids do yourself a favor and just don't my kid doesn't even ask to play anymore and there are times i will play with him but when it comes to anything online just teaching your kid what to look for is not enough because with mics and instant messages your kid will hear things that don't sound bad but are down right evil i've heard older teenagers say some evil things that sound innocent to a kid but are downright evil and grooming behavior minecraft i tend to be okay with but roblox absolutely not and for minecraft i would stick to closed servers where they can play with friends or just an adventure instead of with a ton of people online you need to be so careful with anything online when it comes to your kids because you will have grown ass adults telling small children to end their lives and other awful evil things and if you aren't right there listening and paying attention you might not catch it it is only because i am a strict mom and tend to be over protective with my yr old i caught that stuff i don't let either of my kids ply roblox and never will again

it's been great for my son he's ten now but has been playing roblox since probably six or so during the pandemic it was especially great because it was an easy way for he and his friends from school to get together for zoom playdates they still do that sometimes even now that school has been back in person for a while and friends that he has who have moved away he's been able to keep up with them that way as well i was careful to watch the games that he played initially and we played a lot of games together as well some were quite fun while others were not that entertaining for me but he enjoyed them and we got a lot of good bonding time playing them together there are a wide variety of games some of which are more traditional and others of which allow you to roleplay in various worlds working in a hospital on a submarine etc he used these games the way i used to use fisher price little people very imaginative play developing narrative etc on the whole i think roblox has been a really good experience for him he's had a lot of fun playing it and we've had a lot of fun playing it together as well but it is hardly essential so if you decide it's not right for your family then there's certainly nothing wrong with that

i’m not a parent and i just browse through this thread for reading as i would like to be a good parent when i do become one as a person who has had a lot of experience with roblox including the dark ones i strongly recommend to never let any kids near that game there is very often people who exploit the game and have taken advantage of others i have had multiple traumatic encounters from that game since i played it when i was a kid and almost everyone i met has been a victim on there of various crimes that i won’t go into i have to admit the incidents have increased significantly since i was in elementary school not everywhere is harmful in roblox but it happens too often to ever be considered safe maybe single player games are okay since most of the danger is from other players i’m not too worried about game content other than horror games since although games like that exist they do get taken down quickly another thing if your child gets too deep into roblox it could lead them down a traumatic path or they become toxic or even both i can’t emphasize it enough to never let your child near the game what’s unfortunate about roblox is that it is an easier source into getting started in learning about game development and game design if your child is interested in that i suggest using scratch or introducing them to well received independent games on itch io to start just always triple check what your child is interested in

roblox is bad i made the mistake of allowing my and year olds roblox and i regret it the company truly does not give a shit about kids’ safety or exposure to inappropriate material all kinds of inappropriate stuff is labeled all ages with no ability for parents to control it you can turn off chat but you cannot turn off many inappropriate games call of duty and other first person shooting games horror scare games they are available because some developer labeled them all ages clearly either no one reports these things or nobody cares to do anything about the reports the company is clearly aware of this as any casual user is flooded with this content seriously this inflamed me so much that the next time i see my kids playing these things i am writing my representatives roblox is an immoral company

we got roblox for our kid when she was as her cousins were playing it and it seemed fine i locked down the chat functions so she couldn't talk to strangers and she would game with friends while they chatted on kids messenger seemed great right i didn't understand that it's an open platform with pretty much no limits on what kind of games people want to make she kept talking about things that were making me uncomfortable but not terrible and she had so much fun so we kept letting her play it for about a year as i got more and more uncomfortable and stressed out every time she played it then a few months ago she was playing in the kitchen and i was watching it was the roblox version of sims and she started complaining about someone following her the other character was male and had a listed age of her character was clearly a child this guy kept following her around for like minutes and while he couldn't chat to her he was pinging her with requests to go on his shoulders she kept ignoring them then she went to the school and he followed her in then his character took out a fucking assault rifle and started going around shooting people in the head it had no effect because this particular game wasn't set up for that but it was still really upsetting it had very realistic sound effects hubs and i talked that night and we agreed roblox was gone we got her minecraft and while she sometimes complains she's so happy with it also after struggling with the youtube kids account pushing inappropriate content despite the restrictions i learned that with the app you can change it to approved content only which lets you to set it up to only allow videos channels or playlists that you specifically approve it took a bit of work to set up but honestly it's been such a weight off my kid loves it because she doesn't have to constantly check with me about each video she wants to watch

i know i probably shouldn’t be on this subreddit i’m a y o but it pops up on my home page sometimes i don’t know if i’m allowed to be commenting on here but i’ve grown up playing roblox and this is my perspective i’ve personally never seen anything bad on there i played it from age it’s not a bad game safety wise but it’s far from perfectly safe i’ve read through most of the comments in this thread and people seem to be missing a very important point talking to your kids about cyber safety a year old is old enough to be able to listen and understand the dangers of the internet but he never will if you don’t have that discussion with him this discussion is necessary and or is a good age to have it don’t avoid it it will prevent so many risky situations roblox overall is somewhat suitable for a year old there are parental controls and you can monitor him as often as you need to please set the birthday to be the same age as him maybe even younger the birthday cannot be changed if it is < under s get limited access chat is more heavily filtered no numbers no questions like “how old are you” no profanity etc no access to chat based games violent games etc turn off friend requests and tell him not to turn it on or accept any tell him why in whatever way you feel is appropriate roblox can be addictive limit screen time and don’t let him download it or certain games on it if you don’t feel comfortable with it if you start to notice him getting too attached to the game talk to him and maybe restrict the game don’t dismiss his opinions and feelings when communicating with him and find a fair compromise at the end of the day it’s your choice whether or not you let him play it but let him have a say i’m sorry if this comment is not allowed because i’m a minor i had some other points i was going to make but i’m sick and my brain is foggy sorry if none of this made sense lol have a good day

my year old plays and i have it set so they can play games up to age i have looked and they seem ok for her i also had it set first so she could not talk public or private with anyone after a couple of months we had a discussion and opened it up so she could direct message with her other school friends that played the game this was a trust issue as she was now technically able to friend unknown people and communicate with them we discussed with our daughter the dangers of talking to unknown people online at such an age we said we would trust her to only talk with her classmates as i set up the account and have the parental control i can view her friends and check it from time to time > can he enjoy the building aspect of it without being caught up in the killing gruesome aspect of it our daughter does like to play the among us versions in roblox which has some slight cartoon violence as well as some of these hide and seek games where monsters chase you and can give jump scares again we looked at what was available and did see some violent aspects of some available games and talked to her about how they were not right for her at this time does she ever check them out most likely as she is curious but we stay pretty watchful to make sure nothing gets out of hand and try and communicate with her about why some of the games are unsuitable for her and why online communities can be dangerous at her age \ also side note one of the stipulations of letting her play roblox was that neither we the parents would buy any in game money robux nor would she be allowed to use her own money on this game this game has so many in game transactions possible for little digital items kids would love that i could see it spiraling out of control

not a parent but a heavily involved chronically online uncle who intentionally keeps tabs on what my nephew is in to so i can keep up to date in making sure my parents protect him online i know op has already made up their mind but i think this is just a good resource for other parents who are facing this choice i think being a parent right now is honestly very difficult and things like roblox make it a lot harder on one hand they need to be able to navigate online spaces and learn to navigate them healthily on the other as someone who was brought up just as the internet became popular your children can easily be exposed to things not appropriate but i'd honestly say that any child under probably shouldn't be playing roblox it's far too loose and unmoderated to really allow a child who's still understanding the concept of safe online practices to keep themselves safe and things are so easily hidden by those who would actively take advantage of the spaces very loose moderation the fact that most of its content is community made is part of the problem while great for adults and teens it isn't really conductive to a healthy environment without what is effectively constant spying on your child and honestly that just sounds too exhausting there's a reason there's been so many predators outed within adjacent spaces such as youtube or twitch for those that are leaning towards letting their kids play maybe try making it a thing where you play together it allows you to moderate them while having fun it's what i do with my nephew and fortnite since he's old enough to play it i definitely reccomend the other alternatives that parents have reccomended the switch heavy parental controls and large screens are a must

roblox is *not* safe for a year old not until they're maybe and have some ability to filter bad conversations and evaluate who they're talking to when your kid asks to play and you say no and they say why tell them because it's not safe for you use it as a talking point to introduce that concept tell the truth and don't sugarcoat it first question will you have roblox parental controls turned on second question do you have minecraft parental controls enabled i don't allow minecraft or roblox yet or excessive amounts of youtube for either of my kids who are both under i see both of those games as addictive for little kids who don't have any resistance to that sort of marketing and repetition and the youtube content is just as addicting and potent i often get shouted down and ridiculed for limiting my kids' access to games and other activities i consider addictive but i promote irl activities and make sure that some of them are a little wild or challenging like monsterpalooza or some of the bigger lego kits if i can afford them watching the occasional movie that might require some discussion afterwards due to imagery or blue humor i try to balance things as best i can a year old has very little capacity for balance people who meet my boys are often shocked by how social they are and that we can all go to dinner and not have a single device come out for the entire course of the meal i attribute this largely to limits i place on video games and technology in general i don't ban them i'm not that foolish but i do limit access in various ways video games i do approve of for my kids are those like the lego series of video games no online chat limited interaction with human players roblox can be flat out dangerous and too adult [kids at an age they should know better have been abducted] by having conversations with adults that were sexual in nature this happened *on roblox * we have tablets and vr headsets and the kids do get a few days a month where they can game for a few hours uninterrupted but usually on weekends i give them an hour or two and then have them turn the tablets off no matter what they're doing after about an hour i do this on purpose could you have your kid just turn off minecraft after playing for just half an hour with no issue if not your problem may be bigger than just what game your kid is playing

i'm late to the party but is it safe in a general sense no how do you make it 'safe' * enable parental controls * ensure the account has the below chat filter on * do not let them enter the roleplay community at that age the rp community there isn't exactly safe for people under i'd argue that the roleplaying community is the most dangerous place for a person under to be on the site as its full of legitimate predators and extremely unhinged teenagers * if they ever mention 'condo' games check their account if they've played any games with a name that mentions 'condo' pull them aside and tell them to never play that kind of game again those games are essentially sex roleplay games * if possible just turn off the chat feature it'd be for the best until they're older and know how to safely talk online * if you let them play in games that are multiplayer supervise them * don't enable voice chat keep in mind by 'safe' i do not mean safe there are still risks they may see something in a poorly age rated game or on the avatar of another player like a shirt with an obscene image on it edit added extra dot point

giving him a proper console is light years better than letting him on youtube kids he'll be playing actual full fledged games instead of watching other people play and games with complete stories and experiences instead of free mmos that may be unsuitable for children if he becomes interested in pokemon or mario there's plenty of lore and content linked to that universe itself that'll be exciting for kids and much more appropriate compared to mobile based games in my experience as a private tutor for children youtube is a horrific place if left unsupervised even the kids app there's an insane amount of pornographic themed minecraft story videos and roblox ones for sure one of my first graders was reeled in by it and showed it to me telling me how much he likes the show suffice to say i was mortified and had to spend weeks redirecting him to other content his older brother on the other hand was hooked on pokemon and grew a hobby of reading the comics researching lore drawing watching the shows and even playing older gameboy games on emulators we've had so much engaging discussions and interactions with a hobby in the picture and i find that kids with a focused hobby really thrive in other skills the nintendo switch is also pretty much geared towards children and family friendly games with many multiplayer games to boot you can play with your kid and bond over it many of us grew up with nintendo systems in our childhood and had fond memories of it not all screens are bad it just depends on the content and usage

it’s more of a game engine and not necessarily similar to minecraft except for the blocky graphics each “experience” might as well be its own game and roblox just hosts them also it’s technically an “all ages” platform so parents should be paying close attention to which games their kids are playing they’re not playing “roblox” anymore than you’re playing “unreal engine” when you play fortnite edit they do censor chat pretty well for the most part and provide parents with plenty of tools settings to keep their kids safe of course it’s not perfect but i think a big part of the issue is most parents don’t realize that roblox isn’t just some kids block game which seems to be the popular assumption maybe that’s what roblox once was but not anymore

i get where you are coming from for a lot of people it doesn't really hit as a concern until it has happened to or around them really easy to ignore when it hasn't happened to you kind of thing i will say your parents are in charge of their parental choices and if they have okay'd it then not much you can do just be aware of signs like seperotional behaviours becoming withdrawn private about computer use and realistically they should only be playing with supervision

is it possible of course but while playing with my oldest i once met another dad and daughter we played with a bunch of times after ten plays together i tried to get the dad's information because i really related to him i could not i asked every question known to man and roblox turned it into ******** you cannot communicate real names on roblox phone numbers date of births cities states social media accounts or anything it's all blocked

i am defensive over this lol because it's ludicrous the monetization is really the only thing parents should be worried about none of this grooming stuff i keep reading here that does not happen in modern roblox at all it cannot they have controls against it and the game is free i never buy my kids any robux it has cost us zero dollars for hours and hours of fun

i did not mean conservative politically you're clearly conservative on this issue i appreciate your response but it just appears to me that you're taking an insanely small sample size of experiences and extrapolating them to the entire game roblox is no more dangerous to a child than participating in a sport social interaction will always have an inherent risk but not so much of one that it's not worth doing there is no child grooming happening in the roblox game adopt me a game about collecting pets there is none in fashion famous a game about styling your character to win a fashion show there is none in arsenal a basic kids shooting game based on more popular fps games most of these games have little chat interaction at all and when you do chat even the most innocent words often get filtered and censored be honest have you played roblox and are speaking from experience and if so please give me a scenario where you see the opportunity for kids to be groomed

i was able to type and ask for all of that information just by misspelling things slightly or adding spaces between syllables it’s very easy to defeat someone with bad intentions could easily teach a child how to get around the filter probably as quickly as i did it myself

while i don't disagree with you about the dangers in kids sports and after school activities those options have a higher rate of parent participation which while not free of their own issues don't have the level of private and anonymous that online games do and as such are not as enticing as online games as a means for a hunting ground to those other events they have to show up be seen they can't hide as easily behind a username and profile picture facts to face most parents are not gamers and more still have very little understanding of how the internet and online interactions work some put on blinders and see online games as a they're safe because they're safe in my home these are all facts you are overlooking common when you take personal knowledge for granted when you recommend the game as being safe you're clearly proving my points here because of your own involvement directly in the game you are vetting the games your child plays before hand something most parents don't know to do know how to do or have the time to do so again saying it's safe based on your own narrow experiences and presumed knowledge is incredibly flawed i have played the game unfortunately for me as far as this conversation is concerned but good for the people it's helping i'm unable to go into any details about my experiences as they are currently wrapped into several court cases my recommendation will always be to not allow children to play the game
you know kids play more than one game
most kids who play roblox pretty much only play roblox it's part of the addictivity the game is designed with

i guess it's up to each parent what is appropriate for their own that's fair i think being able to say it's my bday is okay try replying with your actual birth date it won't work video games have a lot of intangibles i played video games heavily too much i will admit as a child and it resulted in me being put into gifted programs throughout my youth my parents didn't interact with me much so i can't point to anything else that would have been a catalyst for that besides the games i played my reading and comprehension and problem solving levels were that of high school by the end of elementary my kids play video games fairly regularly along with participating in dance gymnastics softball music and my oldest has never gotten anything less than an a in all of her classes with minimal effort she was presented with high honor roll just last week we study together but not to such an extent that would warrant that i truly believe that video games have also aided her comprehension skills they've certainly helped her reading to a great extent

that's such a goofy comment there's nothing inherently addictive about roblox i'm sorry your kids were not able to practice self control if that's your experience but mine were perfectly able to play occasionally while being honors students dancers gymnasts and softball players along with players of games like mario pokemon and some others

while i get where you are coming from i think the general consensus is that there are more games with less social risks that kids can play this is a conversation specifically about roblox not gaming in general i absolutely agree that gaming can be beneficial reading math and problem solving are important things for a child to learn they just don’t need to learn it in an unnecessarily exposed environment i would also argue that there are better games than roblox to learn these skills from minecraft offline or lan is a perfect example i think its also unfair to discount the stories other parents have shared you might think its silly but some people here have had their childrens lives altered from an interaction that started in roblox i personally have run into creepy people on every single online game i have ever played
i'm actually basing it on the kids i teach i wouldn't let my kid near it

you make some fair points i agree i could perhaps be a bit more conservative on the issue while i do still believe a lot of folks here could be a little bit more open as well thanks for the good food for thought

but kids get addicted to anything without moderation i don't see what's so addictive about roblox it's a video game kids will get just as addicted to tv minecraft sports etc the key is moderation not the medium itself don't you think

yes you’re right to an extent however this isn’t just a conversation about addiction this is a multi faceted issue involving child predation trauma associated with exposure to mature topics on the internet and addiction i just don’t see what benefit roblox brings that you can’t get on a safer platform also roblox is definitely addictive video games by nature are addictive because they are almost always designed with short reward loops that produce excessive dopamine over a relatively short period of time this is absolutely provable many of the games available on roblox are designed to fit this script you play for only a short while get rewarded play another short while for a reward and so on

every kid is different some kids can pick up games and put them down some kids cannot i have played video games since i was a kid and so has my sister when we got our games taken away she'd lose it she even broke down our parents door and tore their room up just to get her games back i have a year old so i haven't gotten to that stage yet but i notice a huge difference in attitude when she's on the phone watching kids youtube vs watching cartoons on the tv now i only let her watch youtube when she's sick and i need her in bed some people have addictive personalities and some don't do you have bandwidth for extracurricular activities even an after school day care where she is playing and socializing might be beneficial just to get her off the game and interested in something else

all my stepson does is play roblox and if he’s not playing roblox he’s watching a video of someone playing roblox sometimes both at the same time it drives my crazy because whenever we are out or have something planned where he can’t play he is just constantly asking when we are going home he’s only with us days a week and i don’t set those kind of rules for him if it were up to me tablet time would be cut back to max an hour a day during the week longer on weekends but he literally he has unlimited screen time he’s only but its been like this for years i push for my s o to put him in activities or something to he has hobbies outside of roblox to no avail definitely not letting my bio daughter have this kind of freedom with electronics i already notice she gets irritable if i hand her my phone to watch a video for a bit to do a chore or something uninterrupted for mins

it’s banned in my house my year old attacked me violently after we lost power one day and she couldn’t play she was so upset she ended up having a seizure she has a seizure disorder and big emotions are a trigger never again any kind of small screen or computer screen is gone this happened in april and it’s been amazing i hate roblox after this whole incident the only reason i even let her play it was because she was stuck in the hospital for weeks

my daughter never had the withdrawal issues from it but i hated that game it trains children to become internet trolls and i hated every second she was into it monitoring it was a nightmare too she grew out of it after a couple of years i'm a big gamer so her playing games never bothers me but that just a bit much for me too many children running around acting a fool lol 😂

social media marketer here all social media & games with in app purchasing are designed specifically to keep you in app scrolling clicking watching etc it’s how the companies make money and satisfy their board nothing is made with “is this good for children” because that’s counter to profit great example is how [vastly different tiktok in china is vs the usa] the differences in attitude you notice are real and not just affecting kids with certain personality traits these forms of media are designed specifically to be addictive disruptive and drive consumption as a new parent myself this stuff scares me and am encouraging of all fellow parents to be bullish about restricting is kind of media usage it serves no purpose but generating wealth for a tech company and at worse creating educational gaps that can be used in the future to our detriment

in my experience with my then year old and year old i say cut it off completely if they are obsessed with it i hate that game their cousins got them into it and then their friends played it we moved recently and then allowed them to play a couple times and it was like night and day i could see their attitude change arguing not wanting to ever get off the game eye rolling due to flashing light games with running around characters games that basically involve gambling we decided roblox and tablets are not for us as a family because of the addictive tendencies it’s like they get sucked into the game …and i get it there’s so many different games on roblox and the multiplayer aspect and chat feature makes it hard to break away but it was so much harder to deal with a time limit rather than just not play at all didn’t matter if they had sports practice and school activities they suddenly hated every activity besides playin roblox good luck i used to search for answers on what to do because that game really messes with my kids temperament

my son has a deep love of minecraft he's always gravitated towards video games though even before that we struggled the first year of his obsessions covid remote kindergarten made it so much worse ughhhh with setting video game limits but his tantrums over quitting and mood in general eventually got bad he was so we had to take a long break like zero zip bass video games he took is surprisingly well we talked a lot about mental health neuro health attention etc he's a very bright kid kids who gravitate towards video games often are very bright and with enough check ins he started seeing how going without video games was helping he said something like yeah i wake up and i don't feel like i have to play anymore after a couple of months we slowly introduced them back setting a strict schedule allowed one hr days of the week and set a timer when timer went off he had min to wrap up and if he threw a fit he would lose his next session my kiddo is now playing hrs on tues and thurs after school and hrs in am and hrs pm on weekend days unless something else is going on this is usually instead of tv movies me and his siblings will watch a movie and he plays video games for instance with this strict schedule and the tough year of work we did he's in a good rhythm no tantrums or yelling at us etc he'll on rare occasion even quit on his own when he gets tired even if he hasn't hit his time quota one thing i've noticed is how video games are sooooo bonding for kids now days other kids his age all play minecraft too so it really helps him relate w others at recess that play make believe minecraft also he plays a mini game where he learns french ha so also i like to remind myself that video games aren't bad and i don't like using language that sounds judgey of the video game playing treating it like junk or whatever i don't want it to be seen as a guilty pleasure that all can actually promote dysfunctional patterns too like sneaking it hiding it playing in middle of the time etc we also make it a habit to have him show us his characters his builds and watch him do some mini games i guess i've kinda come to love minecraft too now that i think about it lol i've never touched the game myself but seeing the creativity and love for it in my son sparks some love of the game ha
