let’s see bad games horrible moderation bad community broken chat filter… just off the top of my head also they sued a youtuber for several thousand dollars and banned him from ever getting on the game again since they called out roblox’s bad mods anyways let’s go a bit deeper remember the crosswoods incident roblox mods knew that sort of thing was possible since but didn’t do anything about it they also removed tix which was essentially a system where you got some tix every time someone joined your game then you could cash it in for small amounts of robux they removed oof an iconic sound on the topic of sounds they also removed nearly all of them for some stupid reason they removed guests which were a free trial account they ban people for no reason yet let the scammers and stalkers stay reporting people does nothing at all they let images of porn exist without censoring or removing them there’s more but you get the point year old i discovered this post on r roblox thank god i don't use it anymore

i stopped my son y o from playing roblox after a friend's son had an adult man trying to contact him through the game & after reading articles about the following a dad caught some pervert using the game to virtually molest his kid; he lured the kid into his bedroom in the game & was doing sexual motions another mom said her daughter ended up in sex rooms w the characters having roblox orgies some other guy paid young girls in robux to record themselves & send him the videos once i learned all of this i was like nope there are too many predators on roblox i think video games & electronics in general can become addictive for kids not to mention some of the kids playing online are super toxic & say inappropriate things because they have no adult involvement it's pretty obvious that some of them are just allowed to sit on their games all day & have unrestricted internet access & their parents pay no attention to them which is why i set rules for my kid & enforce them he now mostly plays minecraft & rocket league i do let him play cod sometimes because i'm okay with w military style violence vs gta for example fighting for your country cool hijacking a car not cool but all of his devices are now linked to a parental control service which not only filters content but also alerts me when any content or messages contain certain themes topics or words & i also set time limits once his time is up that's it for the day i don't allow him to play first thing in the morning or before he's done with schoolwork & he isn't allowed to play within an hour of bedtime at random when i feel he needs to detox i have no electronics days where he's not allowed on anything at all & has to read or play outside or play w his non electronic games toys i make sure i balance the electronics w reading & sports & family time before i did all of this he was acting like an addict now he's well balanced & there have even been times when he chose to read instead of playing video games
fortnite for my year old

a few years ago we switched to no screens on school days and it was a week of whining and boredom and awful then they remembered how to play and entertain themselves the difference in behavior without screen time was shocking

we have kids and one loves roblox i grew up as a die hard gamer but no real addictive personality we let her play as much as she wants which is often because there isn't much to do and she has never been into crafting or toys and now thanks to covid unless it's a very close friend play dates are a thing of the past anyway her behavior is so much better she's kind and polite she's chill before during pandemic summer # it was an absolute nightmare but she's actually interacting with kids online shes in to role play and trading so that's interaction and that's what she desperately needs so yeah this is a win in my book

no judgement because i know screens and video games work well for some families but this is why we are strictly no video games in my house my older brothers experienced severe addiction issues when it came to video games as teenagers my husband also admits that he was addicted as a teen we won’t be providing any sort of video gaming phones tablets consoles etc for our children they may purchase it with their own money when they get their own job it’s just not a battle i want to fight

i would go cold turkey with roblox for maybe a good month or so get your child back to a normal place then reintroduce the game but with a limit of minutes to an hour at most when my kids were little they were obsessed with tablets and the behavior was out of control when their time was over i got so fed up that i took the tablet away for years we bought ipads again during the pandemic so of course my kids wanted to use them for games after work was done i keep them on a time limit and when they run out that’s it for the day the ipad grays out all the apps so i don’t have to do anything they are older now & so it’s much easier and they accept the limit my kids are fans of roblox too but they have had to learn to use their time wisely best of luck to you it’s very hard but it will be good for them in the long run

is it true yes is it rampant that’s subjective and conflated based on a series of statistics statistics are intended to tell a specific narrative and while truthful should always be read with a sense of skepticism toward the narrative one is trying to tell there are safety tools available in roblox if you’re concerned you should engage the friend’s parents express your concerns and do your part you and your friend’s parents may want to contact authorities together if deemed there is legitimate cause for concern roblox is interesting because it has such a diverse population of players many of the people who started playing roblox when it launched were likely years old and would now be years old in comparison minecraft statistically targeted an older audience in the beginning because it was more difficult to access so the age gap is slightly higher there is a possibility that there truly is a yo on the other side of the communication and this is blown out of proportion long term relationships have budded through online connections and singling out roblox over say world of warcraft is mostly because of the high quantity of young children playing that’s not to say there’s no cause for concern but it’s equally important to have an open mind

roblox is maybe a little bit much for a year old to be able to read all of the game ui and operate the controls but if you do it on an xbox they might have some luck you'll need to vet the games that they try to play for one most of them are trash two some of them might be scary you also definitely want to lock down the ability to communicate with other players turn off all forms of voice and text communication so they can't hear or see what others say and they can't communicate out this might be easier to do on a console versus a pc edit some additional context since maybe you don't know what roblox is it's a place for anybody to go and create a game for others to play you don't have to create anything you can just log in and play other people's stuff but it's sort of like walking into a high school science fair of thousands of different games that you can play within it some of them are pretty good and most of them are garbage with a year old i would encourage you to try playing some of them yourself to get a feel for what they are before you let them loose by themselves

yo is way too young for roblox sure you can turn off the chat and prevent users fro messaging your child’s profile but the games in roblox are created by many different users that means basically anyone can create a game and add it to roblox creators can add whatever content they want which can vary from scary to extremely inappropriate for kids they can also add ways to communicate in games by having like signs that a player can customize read add inappropriate words playing inappropriate songs on in game “stereos” inappropriate graphics inappropriate actions like having your character sit in a specific way and others use the dances emotes to do inappropriate things to your character… and there’s also lots of scary games that many kids won’t like or aren’t ready to play if in the future you want to let your child play roblox i highly recommend you always monitor your child on it make sure you check every single game they want to play before they play it and add safe games that you have approved to the favorites game list honestly just monitor your child online and be extra cautious about any game where players can freely talk to each other and contact each other

roblox can be a fun safe and cool game especially for younger kids but roblox has indeed started to engage with more of the adult players this includes adult games adult ugc things you use to decorate your avatar and adult language to get these you must be + though but since roblox has been focusing more on the older kids over then more adults will be on roblox in general and can join servers with younger kids and can use language around the kids wear bad things in front of the kids and totally just ruin the game especially if the game is targeted for kids more a way to prevent this is by putting parent controls on till they are at a suitable age which can be to your liking the parent controls use a password and can be turned off if the password is correct so make it hard to guess and make sure to check if they are still on while i'm talking about checking their app check their avatar for anything inappropriate check their friends list and make sure to talk about it to your kid to make sure they aren't engaging with inappropriate behavior with others and check their chats that will make sure your kid is safe and not being inappropriate

getting rid of roblox i have an yr old son who plays this game and has become obsessed he doesn’t want to stop playing has anyone successfully gotten rid of this game how did you do it how did you explain etc

what's the reason you need to get rid of it entirely roblox is great creative play when done in moderation engage a bit with him have you ever genuinely asked him why he likes playing the game asked him what it takes to be good at the games he plays i know it looks like mush from the outside but there's often more there than you think beyond that you do have to just set limits explain that you want to trust him with his games but he needs to show you that he can put it down let him play tomorrow for literally only minutes you can be right there with him if he's able to put it down nicely after minutes of play he can get minutes tomorrow if not tomorrow is a break day and you can start with only minutes the next day adjust up every few days he's able to be responsible and adjust down whenever he complains and argues at the end of a session these types of compliance systems can essentially auto adjust to what our kids can actually handle eventually you might let it flex up to an hour or so if he's showing appropriate behavior consistently where you can cap it instead of just enforced cold turkey on something your son really enjoys you're teaching him self moderation skills and putting him in the driver's seat of his own game habits

that's a tricky situation and i think one that lots of parents deal with even for kids who don't have a lot of trauma and other issues i'm not familiar with roblox but do you need internet to play it otherwise maybe you could simply turn off the wifi on the device so she can't chat without a lot more background information it's hard to know if it's safe for her to get more of your trust if she can handle it you could try talking to her more about online safety predators how online posts are there forever and can be used against her how to use it safely and how to keep it fun for everyone a few ground rules about no talking to strangers and if she does she should tell you about them etc but maybe you've already done all this and her condition means she simply can't use it safely yet in that case i think your approach of lots of supervision is completely justified and necessary even though its hard on all of you a last thing could be to only let her play games on the large tv screen if you have it you can buy a chromecast not very expensive or you can see if there's fun games for her on a gaming console this way it's a lot easier to literally see what she's doing without restricting it too much a phone tablet is so hard to really keep track off lots of good luck and good job on doing all you can to keep her safe

one hour is too long the big problem i see with my own five year old is that he asks for video games when he's feeling too tired or uncomfortable to entertain himself playing a game and having to stop just delays satisfying the need he needs to satisfy so he melts down at the end so my rule is that before playing he has to have had a drink eaten something of substance within the last hour and gone to the toilet if there has been evidence of overstimulation or poor regulation during the day so far he can't play not as a punishment but because he'll probably have more difficultly holding himself together and then i set an alarm for twenty minutes if it's a solo game like teach your monster to read or half an hour for a game he needs help for like spiro the dragon he can finish the level life savepoint stage after the timer goes off but not start a new one after that check in with bodily needs again and maybe ease back to reality with a cuddle and a story

when my child has a fit about it being time to turn off the electronics he isn’t allowed to play with it the next day like my son had a fit tantrum last week about having to stop playing a game on the nintendo switch switch and i told him “it’s not good for your brain for a video game to be this important to you no switch tomorrow ” and then don’t cave no matter what that is the most important part every time he has the fit he loses it for a day potentially longer if a day turns out to not be long enough my son is a bit older so the “not good for your brain” has been explained more and now i can say that being addicted to video games isn’t good for his brain and feeling this upset about turning them off is a sign that he’s getting addicted so time for a game break but at he wouldn’t have known what addicted meant this has really helped in our house he understands the “why” and it definitely curbs the behavior because he doesn’t want to lose the device

here's a blog post from someone who looked at roblox more in depth with regards to safety for young children i actually had to block roblox for my son quite a while back because we had set up a child account and he found out from a friend how to create his own account i believe the company behind it has tried to take various steps to create a safe environment but like most internet games it's not going to be enough to be truly safe for unsupervised play for young kids since you mention a phone a helpful tool you might want to look into is circle by disney roughly it's a device you plug into your home network and it allows you to control internet access for all devices on your network and have a lot of easy to use fine grained control over specific game services and such it might help your situation it's been helpful to me because supervised play is just not a reality for parents so these tools help to keep some controls for young kids to be within configured bounds it's not really useful for older kids because they'll find ways around it but it's helpful for younger kids i also echo the other commenter about common sense media fantastic resource for checking things out beyond just generic ratings so you can make your own call as a parent i use it all the time for when my son asks about a new game movie show

we've taken a pretty hard line on roblox with our daughter she's just not allowed to play it at all yet she can play minecraft and other non social games though we've worked hard for years to teach her about safe online behaviors and she's really good with youtube and has earned unsupervised time with that but that's only recently and we still watch mostly with her and review her watch history that kind of thing so it really depends on the kid is really young in my opinion so take it with a huge grain of salt to have unsupervised roblox time there's a lot of risk on that platform for someone so young it's better for older kids who know how to play safely what to look out for etc same with youtube it's so easy to end up down a weird rabbit hole of stuff that's just not appropriate for kids hope this helps and for context we're a very screen friendly home and we're pretty permissive on a lot of tech things our daughter has had her own ipad since she was we've taught her how to use it responsibly both her dad and i work in tech and are well versed in internet safety and you didn't ask about social media specifically but it will come up sooner than later we won't let her on insta snapchat tiktok until much much much later

my yr old twins just started playing roblox after asking for it for a few weeks i knew nothing about it so i did some research and set up the parental account and set their spending limit to zero also set chats and communication to friends list only had a talk about online gaming being a way for the game company to make money and most importantly about how “tricky people” exist online just like in real life and established the rules and red flags of what to tell a safe grown up about they are going to interact online eventually so i figured the best way to go about it was to be involved and honest about it it’s never too late to have those talks and establish boundaries and now you have the added benefit of some learned experience for both of you to draw from maybe even ask him what he thinks is an appropriate punishment i’ve often been surprised at what my kids come up with and think it’s very fair and the behavior has never repeated when they serve their own penance or even just asking him what he could do to pay back what he spent plus interest since it was a credit card two lessons in one lol

anyone can create their own games which is both good and bad this is the reason why there are so many games on the platform there’s a lot of new games being added frequently game creators can add in game purchases purchased with robux which can be special features like unlimited in game currency special boosts like being able to jump higher unlock special packs etc it’s not necessary to buy these sometimes it makes the game faster and easier there are many different types of games in roblox my family enjoys the “tycoon” games where you earn “money” or whatever you’re collecting in the game and build your “base” or whatever you’re building in the game there’s zoo tycoons building and customizing your own zoo pizza restaurant tycoon store tycoon mall tycoon etc since there are a lot of games that are not appropriate for little kids it’s best to monitor them and even play with them we’ve been playing it for a few years and lo only plays on roblox when we’re playing with them they’re also only allowed to play games that we have played ourselves and added to their favorite list so we know it’s appropriate to name a few of our favorite games like work at a pizza place which allows you to earn money by “working” in various positions in a pizza restaurant and you can buy furniture for your home in game make your house bigger buy clothes and accessories in that game club roblox is a roleplaying game where it’s a city you have your own house that you can customize upgrade change work in different buildings roleplay in other careers like hospital police station daycare etc build a boat for treasure is where you build a boat using blocks and if you can pass the course at the end there is a treasure chest where you can earn coins and new building materials there’s a firefighter game not sure what it was called is great for little kids because you get to drive around the city in the firetruck and put out fires bee swarm simulator is a game where you collect pollen from flowers take it to your hive where your bees make honey and you use the honey as “money” to unlock more bees bee hive spots and to upgrade your tools there’s also shooting games for older kids and adults … we don’t play those but there is a game called big paintball that we play sometimes which is just teams blue vs red trying to get the other team my husband found a game like rust that he enjoys playing as well there’s a whole bunch of different kinds of games that’s good for little kids and it’s fun for parents to play with their kids too if you play it with little kids you can set their profile to their age and it won’t show inappropriate words in the chat for kids under i think which is based on the age on their profile you can also turn off the chat to prevent kids from your daughter turning and wanting a bluey themed birthday party is absolutely delightful it's important to remember that children develop at their own pace and interests can vary widely your daughter's love for baby dolls and playing house is perfectly normal for her age and it's wonderful that she enjoys these activities planning a bluey themed party sounds like a fantastic idea especially since you both share an enthusiasm for it while kids at school may sometimes act older it's essential to celebrate your daughter's unique interests when inviting girls from school consider mentioning the bluey theme and gauge their reactions some may still find joy in such playful themes and your daughter might discover shared interests it's a great opportunity to celebrate her individuality while fostering connections with peers who appreciate similar activities encourage her to be herself and she might find kindred spirits who enjoy playing like little girls too other themes could be added to provide a contrast for kids who might not find the bluey theme as engaging activities like games ping pong water balloon fights etc even using roblox i hope this was helpful and i wish you and your child all the best

i don't think she's too old at all i think the real problem is that some people try to raise their kids way too fast an yo should be playing with dolls and dress up and house a bluey themed party is ideal for a kid her age kids should be allowed to just be kids but between media and the parenting styles of certain people kids are being raised to act out of age i'm no conspiracy theorist but i hope you believe me when i say that your baby is definitely not the problem nor are you or even the other kids who act older than they actually are the problem lies with parents who push their young children to be more grown up for the sake of intellect and look what my kid can do in reference to bluey work on the heads later but for now just hearts you're doing great 💚 and i mean no hate to anyone at all i just really and truly think we should let our children go at their own pace i believed in santa clause until i was almost years old i'm almost and i still dress up to go trick or treating i have daughters and my ultimate goal is to keep the magic alive for them as i have done for myself i hope things work out for you guys and as my mom always said fuggem if they can't take a joke not sure if that makes sense haha but regardless i wish you guys nothing but continued love and magic

in my personal opinion roblox is fine for + honestly as long as you have open communication with them and make it clear that you shouldn't try to emulate that in real life it's largely harmless fun as far as i'm aware roblox is a mostly user created game and players can choose a lot of different games or experiences to play through it from their own website games on roblox are officially called “experiences” which fall into a variety of genres users can dabble in games tagged as roleplay adventure fighting obby obstacle courses tycoon simulator and more many of the most popular games on the app including adopt me and brookhaven rp fall into the roleplay category these are less games and more virtual hangouts millennials think of them like gen z’s version of club penguin other categories focus more on agility strategy or skill maybe encouraging them to play a different experience could help or monitoring which experiences they play through roblox but in my personal experience blocking a kid from something they enjoy often just creates more resentful and sneaker kids however each kid is different as is each parent so no shade if you still would prefer not to have it in your house if you are set on no roblox specifically then among us is still fun from what i know it does draw off of the logic puzzle genre so it does at least stimulate the brain animal jam or poptropica are also ok but definitely geared more towards a certain type of person words with friends and draw it are probably fine but won't hold their attention for super long

i’m so sorry please don’t listen to any negative self talk that is clearly not serving you you’re doing your best under insane and intense circumstances with roblox the first step is to turn off the chat function and agree together how to manage and monitor ‘friends’ sit together and agree the criteria for adding friends annoyingly this is what almost every platform calls any other user you connect with for kids a friend is a friend is a friend not a random this is sadly not as easy as blocking or banning or any other one click action it’s a series of conversations and sharing with each other so your child understands that people aren’t alway who they say they are and randoms online aren’t necessarily the same as friends offline if it’s not roblox today it’ll be something else it’s good to start today and be honest tell her that you’re sorry and worry and can see she’s feeling hurt you will both be fine sending all the good vibes to get you through this

i don't know roblox all that well but minecraft definitely fits your requirements the normal mode is single player mode and in order to play on servers she would have to know the server's ip so it's pretty safe in that regard it's also a one time expense with the price sitting at around bucks if i remember correctly it's not a monthly subscription and you have access to pretty much all features without paying extra money for anything i got minecraft for my now year old son when he was and we haven't really had any issues with it just make sure to enforce screen time rules since the game definitely has some addictive potential especially at that age i'd say minutes per day are fine this will be the biggest issue you will have especially since minecraft is fun and it can be hard to stop after her screen time is up however it's important that she has screen time rules and can't just play all day make sure she knows this and don't give in if she asks for more gaming time afterwards minecraft is a great game it encourages creativity especially due to its open world nature you can even turn off the monsters and make it harder almost impossible for her game character to die if that's still too scary for her good luck

as a teenager who used to play roblox for hours on end at the same age as your daughter i'd say to try to slowly pull her away from it my parents weren't that involved with what i did in my free time essentially screen time so i spent most of my time playing video games i definitely would have preferred it if they tried to manage my time after looking backon it but i grew out of it on own and i'm now a perfectly fine student in highschool if you're not already familiar adopt me is a game where kids can pretend to have families something of the sort in terms of appearance it's harmless a lot of kids play this game and i'm pretty sure it's the most popular game on the site this may give you some false pretenses but if you think about it a lot of games out there have many inappropriate ideas in the real world i e shooting people and it's essentially the same here i personally think it would be extremely uncomfortable for her if you were overly assertive like others are recommending to be with stopping her i think it's better to expose to her more healthy hobbies we all have weird things we liked to participate in but it's something that most of us tend to grow out of admittedly if my parents found out about all the stuff i've seen played they'd think i'm crazy but look at me now i'm a healthy student with great grades and i look back on my past and laugh a bit monitor her but most importantly don’t turn a blind eye edit last sentence was a little sketch lol

definitely echoing those who say your apple id security is ultimately your responsibility your kid should never have had purchase access they should have their own id under your family with parental controls for both content and purchasing family sharing lets you share the purchases from each member account among all members of the family including icloud storage which is a really nice feature but it also lets you manage screentime and other parental controls including requiring approval for all app installation and in app purchases hopefully apple can get this resolved for you and at the same time help you establish proper parental controls family setup they are powerful magic when you’re in the apple ecosystem and a significant reason for why it’s a good ecosystem to buy into getting equivalent privacy parental control support and features is considerably more difficult and expensive when using a combo of different platforms like android windows whatever your tv runs etc not impossible but certainly a lot more complicated to manage that makes it well worth it to me to pay the apple tax

yr old girl with adhd she has a phone which she often forgets about having so rarely chooses or thinks to use it but does play roblox with friends and uses the phone for kids messenger no til tok or social media though semi compromise on what she can access absolutely no social junk though

she might feel a bit excluded to be honest i f felt excluded growing up because i wasn’t allowed to watch tv i could only watch what my dad was watching—baseball and the news i didn’t have a radio either my classmates would all talk about the same tv shows and sing the same songs i had no clue my parents were afraid tv radio and comic books would corrupt me i feel like youtube roblox and tiktok are the genz equivalent i don’t allow my son adhd asd to have tiktok either but relented on roblox and youtube because of the covid lockdown i supervise his use though his computer setup is on the kitchen table and i can see his monitor from both the kitchen and living room my ipad is synced to his phone to my relief nothing like the roblox horror stories in the papers has happened he just plays a soccer game with his friends and builds poorly functioning parkour games in roblox studio my son’s youtube use is limited to memes that his friends send him and videos like the “top goals in the premier league” he likes dance tutorials too pretty harmless maybe give her access to roblox and youtube in very small doses ipad iphone or teamviewer can be used to mirror her screen if you want to supervise closely

fellow parent with a year with adhd my daughter is in the th grade and does not have a phone it does not hinder her in anyway nobody makes fun of her or says anything to her about not having a phone for us it’s basically a decision about our daughter being ready when she can show responsibility and show the ability to make good choices she does not have social media and we plan to keep it that way until we feel she is ready
absolutely not don’t let your kid become a screen junkie you’ve done good so far

give them some supervised time on popular platforms teen culture is almost exclusively online these days preventing your child from accessing social media all together will isolate them from a majority of their peers let them “be in the know” so they can keep up with trends and events their friends are interested in you don’t want to make internet access or a phone feel scarce like a treat this can make your child over prioritize their time on social media encourage a healthy balance of digital and real life teach them to use social media to enhance real life maybe help your child create some of their own content

i was playing roblox at y old and im now i love that game with my whole heart yeah theres creeps but learning internet safety is sooooo valuable i had to learn it the hard way but now a days there are resources on how to manage roblox was there for me when i had no friends in real life cause i was kinda just to weird and had undiagnosed audhd and whatever other excuse or explanation roblox has a good system set up too for security just make sure to look at the settings and stuff maybe a gift card on holidays but roblox is easily a good introduction to internet culture without the scary bad influences especially the popular games on roblox

my son is and has a tablet buuuttt i have family link on my phone connected to his tablet he cannot download any games without my permission i can go on my phone to see what games he is playing i have complete control as to how many hours he can play and what apps i can ban he does have roblox but i turned off the chat on his tablet he can see others messages but he can't respond also with family link you can get it with a phone and you can turn it off or set time limits on any apps or on the tablet itself

my child is he only has a phone for safety purposes only we have it pretty locked down with parental controls he has no social media and we don't allow that at all he basically uses it to play minecraft when he doesn't have his tablet or to listen to music off

just as kind of a peripheral note that i think is worth considering apparently the vast majority of tech executives do not allow their teens on social media and or don't allow them to have phones you can google this there's been lots of reporting around it i just think that's really telling in terms of what they know that we don't about how ads and media are designed to keep us ever consuming anyway i think it's smart to keep things heavily locked down limited and monitored but i also think it makes sense to allow certain things in moderation only you can decide what's right for your family and your child my main suggestion is that if you start to loosen the reigns take baby steps and closely monitor your kid and any emotional behavioral changes and don't let your guard down as far as being attentive to how their media consumption social or otherwise is impacting their well being

id start to let her have supervised access with one at this point ie kids youtube she will start being able to make her own decisions too with your guidance even educational games be an option definitely a no no for social media

so i had a lot of restrictions when i was a kid about what media i could and couldn’t consume i grew up just as mobile phones became more popular for older teens i got my first ever nokia when i went to uni in classmates had razr or flip phones and many others didn’t have a phone what i learned from growing up with restricted access to pop culture was that yes it did affect how well i fit into some settings to this day at age people make all sorts of references to things that i don’t get but at it doesn’t really matter i feel you’re doing better for your kid than not the impact of screen time and the fragmentation of attention and inability to be bored are genuinely quite harmful when she’s older i would get her a dumb phone for safety she can get a smart phone when she has a job or saves allowance if this is something you do or when it’s needed for a job your approach of having it on tablet and not phone is a good one as an adhd adult this is one way that i manage and limit my own over use of screens

my daughter is the same age no phone no tiktok no social media apps beyond messenger kids this doesn’t mean that we demonize screen time we don’t our kids have steam accounts and learn programming at a young age social media is the concern they can keep up with their friends on messenger kids and later via text when they are older we give gizmo watches in th grade and phones in th no snapchat etc ever you are not doing her a disservice goodness she sees these friends every day at school right i’m not sure when you were planning on introducing the phone but if it was th grade maybe at the end of this year if th grade maybe at the end of th just pointing out that i can see how it might be extra beneficial to have one in the summer

my opinion isnt based on what she should be allowed to do because of other kids it's honestly your choice because it's your child but i do believe to some level your breathing a social setback your kid needs to develop certain skills since computers tablets and even phones are used now for educational purposes they will be embarrassed to be the only kid in th or th grade who dosent know how to type on a tablet or even do a google search roblox and tik tok arnt neccessary but i do allow my kid to play roblox with her cousins and learn tik tok dances no she cant post online and we've had long talks about what is or isnt appropriate to play watch but i cant censor her from the world only monitor and minimize what shes exposed to i mean shes in th grade and a boy just showed her a video during breakfast at school of a grown man masturbating i wasnt sure how to handle it but i just sat down and asked her if she had questions about what she saw she said no she knew what it was i said how she said kids talk at school and we had our talk last year when she started puberty about self pleasure and privacy i reassured her she can always come to me with questions or concerns then fielded questions about male body hair for minutes to my utter horror lol but we survived it and i'm rather proud of how maturely she handled it all

i think the fact that you are asking the question is enough… especially because your kid has been saying it already maybe it’s time to go to her and say “hey i’m sorry i’ve been so strict i’m worried about you and i let that get the best of me forgive me and let’s collaborate on a reasonable plan moving forward i don’t want to alienate you and i also want you to not be harmed but i know you’ll be hurt in this messed up world and i don’t need to make you suffer because of that ” and then hug yayyy my kiddo had me watch some scott pilgrim movie today and i was completely and utterly shocked that the film had a yr old man dating a year old “schoolgirl” and everyone seemed to be okay with it … but we just talked about it and i might’ve went overboard every single time it came back up on the screen saying how terrible and unbelievable i think it is my strategy is borrowed from my father who would just let me engage any material and would actually engage it with me i have many stories where we watched or listened to something and he intervened on a thought i had and it was a very helpful intervention that no one my age would make i say that to say there might be some balance you can strike maybe you can ask her what she thinks and come to some compromise understanding i want my son to have some agency in his life and at the same time i understand and communicate to him that there are limits because for example porn is really not meant for kids do i tell him not to watch porn yes do i tell him why i think he shouldn’t yes do i expect that he won’t ever watch porn noooo of course he’ll be exposed to it even the cartoons have erotic things going on but when he sees the material he is reminded of the ways that we engaged it — he knows how i feel and hopefully he thinks i have some worthy perspective to consider and then he’ll navigate how he feels he should it’s hard to let go but it might actually bring you closer also look how helpful technology is for you we were watching videos to teach him how to do animation on youtube the other day and he learns about different aspects of music theory he’s and often teaches me what he learns it comes with crap like scott pilgrim but that’s what makes a relationship the complexities he’s allowed to carve out a space for himself that he can show me and it’s not just me showing him stuff you know

my daughter is the same age as yours and she also doesn’t have her own phone she does have screen time but she uses my phone to chat or send messages to her friends all i can say is that i think you’re doing a great job i believe it is our duty to protect our kids and maintain their innocence in this day and age this is not to say that parents who give phones to their kids are bad ones of course but in our experience our kid tried to watch porn using one of our phones when she was and it’s a good thing we caught it we have a close relationship and i do talk to her about the birds and the bees but while she is still under my care i’m determined to keep her innocence i believe it’s best for her knowledge about s*x and relationships to come from us her parents rather than social media or porn when she becomes older i hope and pray she will open up to me rather than seek ‘counsel’ from google she was never ostracised at school for not having her own phone although she goes to a private school where phones are not allowed anyway however we do plan to give her an old school talk and text phone when she starts high school next year we plan to gift her a smart phone once she turns and i’m not sure if it matters but my kid has autism bottomline is…way to go momma 👏🏻

my husband and i are gamers who agree that our kids will not game as much as we did video games today are designed to be addicting with fomo mechanics such as battlepasses mmos social aspect and other predatory designs that build habits for player retention like login rewards if our kids are to play video games we will not let them play live service games or huge time sinks like mmorpgs they'll play couch co op games where we all can play such as overcooked or mario games during a stormy weather theyre fun and easy to put down we have mom and dad friends that did the same and their kids are doing awesome they play outside they're very curious one kiddo built a whole cabin for himself with wiring and plumbing wack

all video games are somewhat addictive basically if they don't make you want to play it then they are not good games however puzzle and online games that are so common in mobile phones are usually a lot more addictive than most of the traditional video games from pc and consoles the social aspect forums streaming youtube only makes things worse my kids are still young so we'll see what happens in the future but for now we set up a policy where the only games they can play are console games hour a day times a week works for us but obviously it's different for each family i thought that they would have better memories of their childhood remembering when they used to play together mario kart or super smash bros than silly repetitive game # on a phone or a tablet by themselves pcs are for homework only a total ban of video games might be excessive but a total ban of something they are not ready to handle as in this case is completely appropriate even most adults can't properly handle how addictive mobile phones can be even without ever playing a single video game in them that's why phones come with settings to limit yourself on the time you spend using a certain application

i think we likely have very different parenting styles i don’t think my children should ever feel shame unless they’ve done something truly awful an year old having access to an addictive game and a credit card and acting on it is not something i would want my child feeling shame over i think this is a parenting failure more than the child’s failure i wouldn’t put cookies in front of my two year olds and expect them to have the discipline to not eat them i wouldn’t give my eight year old access to an addictive video game and a credit card and expect her to have the self discipline to just not use it those are not age appropriate expectations you’re setting the child up for failure there are full on adults who are broke and still buy in app purchases we expect the eight year old to have more self control than many adults if you do have children i would encourage you to look into the impact of shame on children it impacts their self esteem their self worth and their picture of who they are as a person and often times becomes a self fulfilling prophecy e g “you are bad and should be ashamed because you bought roblox” now the child internalizes that she is bad next time she’s considering her actions she thinks i am bad what would a bad girl do there has been tons of research done on this and particularly the impact of shame actions are bad children aren’t bad again i think we likely have extremely different views including our parenting styles

i was a kid who lived on opposite side of country from my dad not military from ages + our visitation schedule was very similar to yours it was the s so video calls weren't an option but we had a weekly phone call sunday nights the only thoughts i have on what you can consider does he always come to you my dad has come to where i live times in years that has been a negative for me when your son comes to you how focused on time together are you or do you just go about your usual routine it sounds like you probably are hyper focused on the visit which is good but if not think hard on whether he may feel unwanted or like an inconvenience if you are just going about life while he is there ie taking pto to work on house projects and he is spending significant time by himself

homeschool i need suggestions to get my son to enjoy school more i have been homeschooling for the last year and after he discovered minecraft and roblox he hasn't wanted to do schoolwork i have even tried to find worksheets and books that are minecraft related to get him interested with no luck i've tried worksheets videos music painting going outside learning based on interests etc on the upside since playing minecraft and roblox his spelling abilities have increased he reads all the time and his computer and tech skills have surpassed what i was at in highschool

if it's possible i wonder if it might help to detox from screens for a while i understand that might be difficult as i'm sure you use computer and videos for your homeschooling too going scorched earth for a while might help him refocus and get perspective back screens and screen addiction are really tough for some kids and it can just be a huge struggle it might help to step back and consider the big picture of your entire school year taking a month off of screens might feel like a huge setback but if it saves your year and makes the rest of your time more productive maybe worth it in that time you take off screens you could maybe try redirecting his attention into things like educational board games or borrowing a large selection of books on different subjects and see what piques his interest and go from there and then start slowly reintroducing screens with limits once he seems like he's doing better the opposite approach could be to lean into it i don't know about roblox but minecraft does provide some avenues for creativity and spacial reasoning perhaps you could find some way to use this to your advantage you could agree to let him have more time playing minecraft if he uses that time to say recreate topography or famous landmarks then he'll have to do some research on like the arc de triomphe or whatever in order to build it in minecraft and maybe you could get him to write some notes on it while he's working on it a small research assignment perhaps idk i'm sure there's a way you could harness the obsession but i guess it all depends on whether you feel that it's healthy or not

i teach him he enjoys learning when he is interested in the subject he is very smart he loves to read spell and learn about the body he loves to learn about how to be healthy and how our body works he is very artistic and loves to dance and sing he has trouble with visual math but can do simple math orally he has learned about different elements the human body different weather anomalies different states and landmarks and raised frogs from eggs i was looking for advice on how to get him to be more enthused when it comes to sitting down and doing the work he would be the same at school we tried school they either want to put him in sped because he is autistic or they don't give him the attention he needs to understand some subjects while in general education he doesn't need a ton of attention but sometimes just a little extra attention he also is suffering from attachment issues right now when we did in person schooling he would cry to the point of not being able to breathe when i left i have worked with him on this and now can leave the room for speech therapy

recommendations for slow low stimulating age appropriate shows for year old tldr i need recommendations for slower shows for my six year old after much discussion research and inner turmoil recently we seriously adjusted our family rules around television ipad and mobile devices we removed youtube roblox kids messenger and all high stimulation games from their ipad we have also only been watching pbs kids on the tv or a family movie occasionally in the evenings i deleted all of my social media except reddit obviously off of my phone in solidarity as well it’s truly been a peaceful couple of weeks the behavior sense of togetherness and all around tranquility have soared pbs is great but also pretty limited as far as shows for older kiddos any suggestions for slow and low stimulating shows for a six year old we have access to most streaming platforms typically before the rule change they’d watch shows way more geared for pre teens and the influence was overwhelming i’d like some options more for their age
documentaries
hilda my favorite kids show next to bluey

bluey great games to learn an play at home life lessons something the adults can watch too octonauts very fun an educational has a blurb about the real animal at the end if each story tales of arcadia amazing story telling and imaginative plot sonic boom it has a lot of good plot surrounding friendship

tumbleleaf i think it’s on prime it probably is geared towards a little younger than but my almost year old still likes it a lot very very relaxing and science y winnie the pooh any of the movies and puffin rock as others said

i like stinky and dirty on prime cheerful and upbeat but much less stimulating than a lot of shows i think trash truck on netflix is similar treehouse detectives and if i were an animal on netflix also move at a slower pace while still being engaging

my son just turned he loves is it cake wizard of oz time warp trio the thundermans mary poppins charlie and the chocolate factory nightmare before xmas old disney like robin hood fox and hound beauty and the beast he also likes watching youtube channels that are educational like a kid explains history be amazed top s etc

this is a good age to show kids classic movies color & black & white the movies released before the ratings system are interesting for adults but a tiny bit slower paced studies have shown that watching these movies from the s s also show kids how adults deal with grown up issues in a child friendly way look for comedies action and musical movies with actors like cary grant irene dunne steve mcqueen natalie wood jack lemmon ingrid bergman humphrey bogart kathleen hepburn judy garland etc two fun halloween movies “arsenic & old lace” with cary grant “the ghost and mr chicken” with don knotts kids love the halloween scene of “meet me in st louis” a musical with judy garland and the youngest daughter is five years old and is a very interesting character bringing up baby my favorite wife the magnificent seven the man who shot liberty valance the great escape some like it hot the great race natalie wood tony curtis jack lemmon is a long movie hrs but is divided into many different manageable sections with so many different cool scenes kids love it long car race a western brawl humongous pie fight a villain wearing black and twirling a handlebar mustache against a hero in sparkling white clothes from head to toe for movie musicals the music man ron howard at age is very relatable in this film and the cast is fantastic “singin’ in the rain” this one is very funny very silly guys and dolls lil’ abner show boat oklahoma hope this helps

this might be an unpopular opinion on reddit but please keep her away from this stuff the screens the electronics the games just use everyday objects to teach her counting or a language read books with her take her to museume maybe let her watch cartoons in another language but she's way too young to play any kind of video games there are surely things she can learn from playing but electronics are incredibly addicting and the long term effects of too much exposure at a young age are crippling maybe she get her into a multi lingual kindergarten when she's at that age i understand it might be too expensive just an idea

welcome to my world man do my kids love roblox they also love watching videos of other people playing roblox roblox is fairly harmless some of the games do involve shooting but it's very low resolution and there's no blood it's like minecraft level graphics but if you don't approve of anything relating to guns just make sure to monitor what your daughter plays i've banned my kids from playing virtually all first person shooters but i find most roblox games even the shooters such that they are to be fine roblox has a ton of games that are user created so it's tough to really say what type of games there are because there are so many fortunately for my kids or unfortunately depending on who you ask i'm a fairly avid gamer so it's a lot easier for me to figure out which games are appropriate for children and which games aren't it's actually pretty hard for parents who aren't into gaming because of how games have exploded on the internet be careful with some of the roblox videos some are harmless but others aren't depending on your threshold for profanity crudeness some of the videos may not be appropriate for your child i've had to ban a few youtube channels from my kids because of that also consider that some youtube personalities yeah that's a thing just get used to it are very annoying and your child may pick up some of those annoying traits it's probably worth watching a few episodes to make sure that you're fine with the content

imo the minor obsession is typical for her age especially with games like roblox and minecraft as long as it is not interfering with daily life it shouldn't be a problem if she starts to choose the game over real life or as an avoidance tactic you may have concerns especially considering the social anxiety history in your family as far as interacting with others this is always going to be a risk with online games and apps this might be a good time for a brief conversation about internet safety and when she should bring something to you roblox does offer parental controls so you can choose certain restrictions including chat and content related controls for those under go into the game settings and you should be able to choose these options among others online features are now a part of nearly all games and it will likely only intensify as she gets older i highly recommend that she show you any game or app she starts using so you get familiar with the content you can use great resources like commonsensemedia org but user created content has the highest likelihood for slipping inappropriate content into games intended for younger users nothing beats watching her play or better yet playing it yourself

i play roblox with my son it's pretty much good wholesome fun there are some mods that worry me though like where you pretend to adopt kids and you can either play the kid or the parent that's weird but we don't play the weird ones thing is anyone can make a mod we mostly play pokemon mods prison mods tycoon mods and dragon's birds dinosaur emulators i can see where someone would play all day on it there is so much content the trick is to get up and stretch do something else every couple hours i think it's ok to have friends in this game as long as you don't share your personal information with them that might be a good talk to have with her

i’m a teenager m myself for about or years i played minecraft a ton watched videos when i could stayed up late with online friends in the game and would often hop onto skype discord to be able to talk to them at the same time i don’t think there’s anything wrong with this kind of behavior as long as it’s safe if you’re communicating ~~with online friends~~ strangers outside of the game do be sure that they’re actually kids and not deceiving your child pretty easy to tell if you’re on a call lol voice is easy to recognize as a kid’s or adult’s block people that aren’t who they seem to be the most important thing for you to do for your daughter is to naturally show important things are outside of the game too many kids only live one life their online life school and family is just a grind for them i think i did pretty well balancing my online life and **keeping up with my schoolwork irl in real life friends family and **hobbies**** that’s all pretty much if you have any other questions from a teen’s perspective ask away

roblox is geared towards kids for sure i put in a good amount of hours in that game when i was in the future if you need to know if a game is appropriate for your child use esrb org they rate all games based on the level of maturity just like movie ratings on the site they give explanations for the ratings which i find helpful however online interactions are not rated by the esrb

yeah roblox is harmless it's honestly a bit young for yos in fact kids need to roam around in unsupervised packs and that's just not something modern lifestyles allow for when you were a kid you got to wander or bike around the streets with your friends but that's been denied to their generation multiplayer gaming has stepped in to fill that gap it lets them practice a bunch of social skills that just aren't available via playdates or the schoolyard; it lets them be pack for want of a better word yeah the video obsession is normal projecting their socialization into that world makes it awfully compelling to watch and freeform games like roblox strongly facilitate storytelling in the medium as well a little common sense around online safety no personal details no meetups etc has the stranger danger angle covered of far more concern with gaming in general is kids getting exploited for micro transactions various games have in game items you pay real money for and the marketing and peer pressure to have the latest and greatest can be relentless no different from whatever collectibles or must have status symbols kids obsessed over in your day but in game ones can be really insidious i don't think it's unhealthy at all but you might do well to fence off certain times for other activities as it can be easy to spiral into it

gamer moms weird i know but are there gamer moms here i love gaming and have loved it since i was both me and my husband play alot of pc games monster hunter souls games overwatch etc we also have a year old i'm afraid that if my child grows up and sees that i'm into video games it will affect her in a negative sort of way like she might not be focused on studying etc since her mom plays games and she'd end up having a video game addiction idk lol i only play when she's asleep but our house is a geek's heaven with different consoles and pcs name it we have it i just feel like moms should only be baking cooking reading books doing arts and crafts and being all motherly like my mom and not gaming or playing drums or building gundam kits or listening to heavy metalmusic i guess my question is are there moms here that share similar interests but their kids turned out y'know okay lol i know it's weird but since being a mom i've been lost not knowing if i should give up my passions and just have typical mom hobbies edit so many great replies eye opening ones too thank you i am relieved all the stories of families gaming together made me excited to play with my daughter and i won't lose my passion and what makes me who i am

let’s recalibrate the way you see moms some moms bake my sister is a crunchy mom she makes the cute bento lunches for her kindergartener homemade granola bars for her toddler every dinner is from scratch she sews their clothes and does all sorts of neat things like that she’s a great mom some moms read and work my sister in law is amazingly smart and scholarly she teaches university and does research her kindergartener speaks + languages and goes to conferences with her she’s a great mom some moms craft and run and game and work full time my kindergartener does road races with us and helps pick out colors of yarn we play age appropriate games together pokémon skylanders and they learn how to be strategic and a good winner loser i’m a good mom moms come in all shapes and sizes we don’t fit the cookie cutter mold of the s ideal mom and that’s okay your kid won’t like everything you like and that’s okay they won’t be traumatized because you have your own interests if anything knowing parents have their own interests and are their own person can help children establish their own personalities interests and opinions with less pressure and struggle as long as there is respect love and care you’re exactly the mom your kid needs

being a mom doesn't mean you have to stop being who you are plenty of moms in my generation older millennial enjoy video gaming listen to heavy metal music have tattoos etc all the things traditionally frowned on for women don't let the patriarchy dictate your interests the best thing you can do for your kids is to not bend to becoming a stereotypical suburban housewife if that isn't what you want to be your kids will be fine as long as you aren't ignoring your parenting duties all day every day to game instead that would be neglect even if you were abandoning your parenting duties to garden all day or something

i’m a stepmom bio mom to be sometime this month and playing video games with my stepsons is a big bonding experience every night we have them before they go to bed we all sit together and have a snack and either my husband or i play a story based video game for them while they settle down we’ve gone through lots of cute indie games i got a rare unsolicited “i love you” from my oldest stepson who said “if it weren’t for you we wouldn’t be playing zelda windwaker and i really like this game ” lol i’ll take it i have fond memories of sitting in my dad’s lap as he played myst as a kid and watching my parents duke it out in dr mario and mario kart and even now i play games remotely with my teenage nephew to stay connected with him as he lives several hours away i think video games can be so fun and social it’s when they get to be antisocial and not fun just hits of dopamine with no fun involved that we have to put up boundaries it’s not super active but i like r momgamers to see what other moms are playing
there’s a lot more of us out there and it’s more common than you think lol 😂

well in our house we all game listen to metal my y o son plays the drums i ride horses etc these days i mostly play low conflict peaceful games because it's honestly good for my mental health but not always kid and husband play overwatch monster hunter lol borderlands etc our video game budget is intense i was always into it too when game boy first came out i saved up so much christmas birthday and odd job money to buy one i also saved up and bought my own playstation when that came out my little brother was so mad i took it to college with me now we have like gaming pcs switches multiple consoles from various generations the fastest internet money can buy you will often find some combination of us bonding by playing video or tabletop games together i have passions outside of gaming i ride horses and mountain bike and love hiking and kayaking and the outdoors i like making art i'm not good at it but i do it anyway i love going to concerts and music festivals and we bring out kid to them when it is an appropriate band s venue etc i have no issue at all with role modeling enjoying gaming to my kid i do also like to role model having a variety of hobbies and enjoying physical activity and nature but i like those things if i didn't i might not force myself to role model doing things i don't enjoy beyond that having some physical activity in your life is like eating vegetables just something we need to teach our kids is important to their health i have seen no bad outcomes from this i have never gotten on the screen time will rot your brain train and never counted screen time minutes i just make sure there's plenty of good stuff and balance i'm okay with modeling that sometimes as an adult woman i am going to do my own thing and often that is gaming hell sometimes i'll leave the dishes undone tonight because i got a new game and i'm excited but i'll catch up tomorrow kid works hard in school gets good grades teacher has complimented his work ethic and said he tries hard he reads at or above grade level he's interested in so many different things he has great pc skills because he also gets into digital art on his pc and going into a word processor and writing stories if a question strikes him like a science question or something he googles it he's well mannered kind and polite funny thing actually last night my kid was asking me to write down his roblox account name so he could give it to a friend i was like dude you should make a little business card your name your roblox account steam account and nintendo friend code he did make them cut them out and has them ready to give to friends at school

no it’s important for your kids watch you pursue the hobbies that you enjoy it’s good for them to see that you especially as the mom have a life outside of them we live a similar life i don’t game like i used to because i have kids and no energy but my husband frequently plays in front of the kids he has bought some games to play with our year old our house is similarly geeked out as long as it’s not just all about gaming and you introduce them to other things so they can find the hobbies they enjoy and support those hobbies they’ll be fine my husband and year old like to bake and cook together we all read together i like to do arts and crafts with them which they enjoy we’re trying out different sports but at the same time my husband also listens to metallic in the car with them “patallica”as my son calls them my year old sings parts of master of puppets at daycare it’s about balance and it’s certainly not your job to fit into the old mom mold

here's an interesting experiment ongoing in my life i have twin girls currently age everything for them has been the same since birth except those differences that are individual to them similar experiences different people my husband and i are gamers video games being # followed by board games escape rooms puzzle books you name it my kids have been gaming in some fashion since they were one of them is growing up to be a gamer i will not be surprised if she goes into coding she's an introvert loves being home quiet time personal space reading fantasy stories making potions and all that goes along with geek dom the other one is a social butterfly would rather play with friends than play video games would rather host tea parties than play board games would rather be outside than inside would rather be the center of attention than be alone no matter how you raise them they will be who they will be

i can’t speak from a future stand point but i currently have a yo and another on the way partner and i are both gamers as well pc ps switch i try to do most of my gaming when he’s sleeping as well but the odd time we will play something when he’s awake on that note we do so many other things with him l between playing crafts getting outdoors and even have him assisting in the kitchen cooking baking etc we also include him in our daily ongoings of tidying i think the key is balance i agree with u aseapersonbynight about recalibrating how you view moms it takes all kinds of moms to make the world go round from the outside looking in there always seems to be someone doing it “better” which in reality is not better it’s just different i have friends with kids they seem to be able to work full time find all this time to make everything from scratch do laundry all while keeping their house spotless while i have in the past felt i was an “inferior” mom when in reality i’m doing all very similar things i reminded myself that my child is health fed and loved and that’s all i can ask for could my house be cleaner if i did game maybe but maybe i wouldn’t do it anyways give yourself some grace we don’t have to give up our hobbies and sense of self when we become moms we adapt so we can still do something for ourselves you’re doing a great job

a lot of internalised misogyny happening here op mums can be any type of person with any type of hobbies — same as women who aren’t mums some mums bake some garden some fix cars some paint some are musicians some are gamers there’s no expectation that men need to stop *insert hobby here* when they become dads so don’t box yourself in only possible behavioural change would be watching your game rating around your children and if you already do that then awesome i’ve been gaming since and i have two teenage daughters who game they’re *also* a+ students and they have other varied hobbies they’re not just game addicted zombies as long as you’re encouraging a balance it’s fine to be a gamer

i’m a gamer and i have a five year old she knows that i like video games if she wanders out of her room late at night she often finds me locked in combat haha and i play games with her sometimes i just try to set limits games are for after other things are done we don’t play if the room is a disaster and needs tidying we don’t play when dinner needs to be cooked or the dog or the cat needs care or if she needs to choose her show and tell for school the next day i think people can still be responsible adults and play video games so i try to model that for my daughter my husband and i are both careful about when and what games we play around her since we don’t want her exposed to any violent or disturbing content at her age

i play pc games and sometimes console i am not giving up gaming anytime soon i have made a significant effort to learn to do certain things i wished my parents taught me things i felt would have made my life a lot easier i didn't have anyone teach me how to cook or how to manage my finances two things which i felt would have significantly affected some of my life choices either having a better diet being a better cook and how to avoid unnecessary debt i think that if you don't want your kid to be addicted to gaming then you yourself should be aware of how much time you spend on gaming too try to do other things in addition to gaming so that isn't your child's and your family's only hobby for instance my husband and i game on a daily basis however we still make home cooked meals go for walks go to the gym go to the park enroll our son in sports do crafts color and have days filled without just being glued to a computer i do specific things to create an environment that will help my son be well rounded also you may want to open up your perspective of what a typical mom is supposed to be you don't want your bias to carry over to your children

yes i'm an older pc gamer mom i chose to raise my kids screen free when they were little because of this maybe it's just me but if i have a hard time playing in moderation and other things do suffer i tend towards gaming addiction and wanted to spare them from that i started playing again when they were in school i do regret a couple of those years because i feel like i was less there for them they're older now and think it's cool that i'm a gamer mom they're both gamers now too i have mixed feelings about that i am glad i took years off from gaming and able to focus on them right now i struggle with balance because they need me less my daughter still hates if i play too much i think she remembers me going from super mom all the time to being more checked out when i started again and it upsets her for the new year i boxed up my computer again which i do about once a year lol i've only got a few years left with my kids at home gaming can wait i hope because of my struggles with balance i do talk to them a lot about being aware of that

holy outdated gender roles batman i'm a gamer too though i have to limit myself because i'm the type of person who can get so wrapped up in games that i struggle to sleep eat go to work i actually avoid the games i would find most exciting because i worry i wouldn't be able to control myself in high school i was so obsessed with text based rpgs the predecessors to wow when graphics and internet connections weren't good enough for that sort of thing that i only slept about hours a night and started to hallucinate and have other mental health issues but that's all beside the point there's nothing wrong with women gaming there's nothing wrong with children seeing women game in fact it's great for kids to be exposed early to the idea that games science technology sports history theater baking anything and everything is ok to both girls and boys gaming culture can be really toxic specifically because men who currently game didn't get taught that and now get their boxers in a twist over sharing the space let's end that as quickly as possible and let our girls enjoy gaming or baking etc and our boys enjoy knitting or baseball etc and our enbies enjoy bird watching or matchbox car racing etc basically give kids plenty of options explore and let them pursue the ones they enjoy your child may be more likely to like gaming because they see you doing it but in that case you have a shared interest with your child which sounds wonderful to me

fellow gamer mom chiming in if you model healthy gaming behavior it can be really good for your kids does my yo see me play pokémon for hrs on a saturday afternoon she sure does but only after we do that days chores she also hears me say “okay that’s enough gaming for today time to make dinner ” so she knows that i don’t just sit around and play the whole day we’re also careful to limit her game time and if she puts up too much of a fuss when it’s time to shut down the games she loses access to video games for a few days thats really starting to sink in so we’re getting very little push back these days i love sharing my favorite games with her we got pokémon brilliant diamond and shining pearl for christmas and we’re each playing one it’s a blast video games also helped fuel her desire to read which i think is pretty cool there’s nothing wrong with video games as long as you keep it age appropriate and help kids understand enforce healthy limits

mum family here so we have two to use as examples i think the very important things are how often you play and how it gets in the way of other things how you are when you are playing the games you are playing and the visibility the child has over those games if you play all day every day ignoring the world around you being insanely angry over it and your child sees horrible violent games and sees you throwing things around the room then no don't do that i actually think there's a risk that a lot of children see parents as people to serve them and only them some kids don't see their parents as adults with their own hobbies and it can make kids a bit selfish lol i play cute games like stardew valley and theme hospital and my wife plays different games cute games like me and also fifa gears of war gta etc my daughter rarely sees us playing games and if she does it's games that are suitable no shooting games etc and she's not messed up yet lol

i could have written most of this myself ours are and there's tech everywhere as their dad works in the industry and i did bits here and there and i'm now doing a development course that's been interrupted more times than i care to think by covid induced homeschooling there was no way they'd not see games and tech in this house but we make sure to avoid playing violent stuff in front of them and anything really sweary or screamy gets headsets both children play all sorts but we limit the time and we try to keep them from playing every day we play with friends one afternoon every weekend so they get to play then and that's their biggest gaming session too but i'll usually expect them to have earned it by us going for a walk doing some tidying reading and so on both have plenty of friends and outside interests tennis tai kwon do after school football for him and multisports for her for instance so that fear i had about them becoming social rejects or addicts wasn't worth worrying about we're starting to see some benefits to the extra tech exposure with our son i guess he is very it literate and extremely interested in development we set him up with the first couple of videos from one of my courses unity development and he was very keen to get going and while he might not get very far into it for now it's exposure to something else to broaden his horizons

gamer mom of chiming in… we have every console and many gaming pc’s my kids and all play games my only rules are no gaming monday thursday nothing too scary for the littles must clean up their messes before gaming after an hour to two hours it’s time to get up and go outside sometimes mario party takes awhile my yo and i play blizzard games all of them switch games ps games hubby plays xbox and steam games and the littles mainly play the switch but sometimes they’ll play on their computers ipads i mainly use it as a reward and also to connect with the kiddos now before i get hated on we play board games we play outside we have quads motorcycles and a huge playground on our back yard we go on vacations that consists of all of us going dry camping up in the mountains there’s always a healthy way of incorporating all things you like with your kiddos and if i’m honest the and year olds will only game sporadically they get board and find something else to do also depends on the situation example my kids were on break for the past two weeks last sunday we played mario party smash brothers and mario kart all day long except in the morning we painted we don’t really do the whole “limit your screen time” thing because the kids get bored anyways and walk away i loved when my yo and i would play world of warcraft together we’d play hide and seek and just goof around i’d like to also add i sew i bake i paint i keep fish i garden and i hate laundry lol… not one of us fits a specific mold we are all unique and absolutely perfect unless you’re an asshole then you suck lol i think you are doing wonderful keep doing you and get your baby going on mercy we always need support ❤️❤️❤️
